programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Swansea and Bridgend compete to throw the best dinner party. Kathy and Justin kick off the competition with an Italian-inspired menu, which is overshadowed by Paul's poor table manners and tactless banter. Mark and Maria are the next to host and serve their leftovers-inspired starter, chicken lettuce boats. Finally, it's time for Kathy to wreak revenge during Paul and Sarah's evening. Chaos in the kitchen ensues, culminating in a showdown at the table.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick Pawnbrokers boss Nathan and manageress Debbs take a spin in a mini-hovercraft, and at Nikolas Patrick in Kent, Charlie turns his attention to skateboarding merchandise.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan takes his sister to test drive a monster truck, Wendy comes across a handbag that could be very valuable, and Larry and Neil examine some works of art bought in a pub.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit Windsor in Berkshire to guide Paul and Alissa, who hope to buy a mansion, but have a limited budget. They also advise Matt, who wants to settle down close to his family after a period of travelling and get on the property ladder.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps Home Counties air stewardess Karon and Newcastle duo Anita and Andrew find the properties of their dreams.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mother and son team Trish and Connor Richardson host at the Red Lion Coaching Inn near Gainsborough, where Julie and James are not impressed by the dated bathrooms.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: NHS manager Helen Mather holds the first party in Leicester, hoping her plans for a simple menu will allow her more time to entertain her guests. However, the accident-prone host has a mishap involving raw pig's blood, and tries to turn the evening around with some `urban ballet' after one diner sours the mood with a display of less-than-polite table manners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Terry Robinson hosts the second dinner party in Leicester with a `Dress as Your Hero' theme, and the Elton John fan also decides to treat his guests to a song. He is confident his menu will score him top marks, but while Richard is blown away, Ryan remains unimpressed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beauty spa manager Porchia Lee hosts the third dinner party in Leicester, serving up a French-themed menu of chicken liver pate, pan-fried chicken with tarragon sauce and creme brulee. Unfortunately for her the pudding is so bad her guests are reduced to tears, and double glazing salesman Richard Deeping insults her appearance.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT enthusiast Ryan Bruce hosts the fourth dinner party in Leicester, and tries to impress his guests with a Spanish-inspired menu cooked in front of them. Entertainment is provided by Ryan's sister, West End actress Charlie Bruce, who puts the contestants through their paces in a salsa lesson.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Double-glazing salesman Richard Deeping hosts the final dinner party in Leicester, and hopes to make up for his boisterous behaviour by impressing the guests with his culinary prowess. In a bid to land higher scores, he puts on his own brand of entertainment, only to reveal a little too much of himself in the process, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Amit Kleinberger, the CEO and co-owner of frozen yoghurt chain Menchie's, poses as a participant in a reality TV contest to find out whether consistency is being maintained in his stores. The company has experienced rapid growth and Amit tries to establish what changes must be made to become a billion-dollar business.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mike Bloom, president and COO of discount retail chain Family Dollar, intends to double its number of stores within a few years. He decides that to do so he first needs to go incognito within the organisation to monitor where the firm is excelling and where it needs improvement.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of the Old Stone Mill restaurant in Tuckahoe, New York, which is struggling to attract customers, leading to debts of nearly $1million. Gordon feels the owner is more interested in his own appearance than how his food tastes and a screaming match ensues.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help house-hunters in Oxfordshire, beginning with military couple Chris and Nikki, who have their hearts set on a rural home with plenty of potential to renovate. The property experts also come to the aid of Richard and Jane, who wish to move their large family into more suitable accommodation. Despite a budget of £500,000, the task seems impossible to achieve because of their extensive list of requirements.(n)

programme.title: Catching a Killer
programme.sub-title: Catching a Killer: The Wind in the Willows Murder.
programme.desc: In April last year, 42-year-old antiquarian book dealer Adrian Greenwood was found dead in his home, having been stabbed more than 30 times in a frenzied and brutal attack - with no suspects, no witnesses and no sign of forced entry. This documentary follows the work of the Thames Valley Police Major Crime Unit as Det Supt Kevin Brown and his team embark on their investigation into who killed Greenwood, as well as find out what happened to the victim's early edition of The Wind in the Willows, worth £50,000.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 19-year-old student Marlie from Yorkshire, who keeps choosing the bad boys - which is driving her mum mad. There's also 30-year-old Adam, from Bradford. Having previously had his heart broken, he is now looking for a woman with no secrets, and believes that if the contestants are willing to bare all on TV, they probably have nothing to hide.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides Joel Dommett, Jermaine Jenas, Adil Ray, Tamara Wall and team captain Rylan Clark-Neal on an epic adventure through four fantastical zones - Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Futuristic. In each zone the team members must conquer physical, skill, mystery and mental challenges in a bid to win crystals. These elusive crystals each give them five seconds inside the iconic Crystal Dome, where they hope to collect gold tokens to convert into prizes.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan taking on guest captain Richard Ayoade and Katherine Ryan, and Bill Bailey in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Nahida from Liverpool is searching for a man who shares her passion for food, and her date is with fellow Liverpudlian Thomas, who describes himself as a loveable bear. Ex-cruise ship worker Dale, 46, has been single for five years since his partner passed away, but is now ready to put his faith in Cupid again, and his date is 39-year-old massage therapist Chris.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eatery's co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jane Grote Abell, the Chairwoman of Donatos Pizza and daughter of the company's founder, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win money to open her own restaurant. Her aim is to uncover where the company is going, what plans for the future should include and whether her father's values are still being upheld.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Anthony Wedo, President and CEO of Buffets, Inc, goes undercover to find out what his staff members are really like. He was brought on to the team to turn the firm around after years of challenges and poses as a construction worker to find out the flaws in the business.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three pairs of partners from Blackpool compete to win the £1,000 prize, including former dancer Rowan and businessman John, who start the proceedings. Also vying to win are Sally and Joanne who hope to impress their guests with an unusual menu that features a Tandoori Tower and a belly-busting breakfast, before competitive duo Holly and Ollie pull out all the stops in an attempt to secure the cash.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawnbroker Dan at London Road is faced with a collection of crystals that owners Lynette and David want big money for. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick run aground while testing a speedboat, and Sophie wants instant cash for her diamante-covered Jimmy Choo shoes.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Larry from Cashbrokers in Penzance goes to look at some antique petrol pumps, while in south-east London childhood sweethearts want to pawn their jewellery to fund a family reunion.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer travel to Aberdeen, where they give expert advice to newlyweds who are looking for a spacious city-centre home, and a couple willing to leave the hustle and bustle behind to find a rural retreat.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps two sets of house hunters in Staffordshire and Warwickshire, looking to find both the buzz of the city and the peace of the country.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Julie and James host at the Schiehallion Hotel in Aberfeldy, where the guests are impressed by their rooms, but once again luxury lovers Andy and Jeronime want more from their beds.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Natasha Conti hosts the first dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, and puts together an evening on the theme of a summer fete, complete with prizes for her fellow competitors. However, as the guests get to know each other, Chris Hiller finds himself in an awkward situation.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Farm manager Sophie McConnell hopes that her pig-racing entertainment will impress the guests on her night as host in Salisbury, Wiltshire. She also plans to serve her home-raised cow Levi for the main course.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Anthony Brown-Hovelt hosts the third dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, and his menu includes Uzbekistani food and porridge ice-cream. The former army major dresses as an American sailor, but Natasha Conti does not find the outfit as appealing as she had hoped.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housing support officer Chris Hiller plans an eclectic but affordable menu for his night in Salisbury, Wiltshire, including chicken a l'orange and peppers stuffed with baked beans. However, with the sole focus being on keeping costs low, his efforts might not go down well with the other guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Care worker Jane Arnold hosts the final dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, hoping to impress her guests with food from her local area. However, it is her bedroom revelations that catch the diners' attentions, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Paul Quentel, president of Alfred Angelo, the second largest bridal retailer in the United States, goes undercover to solve any problems as quickly as possible. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Travis Boersma, co-founder and president of one of the largest privately owned drive-through coffee shop chains in America, goes undercover to learn whether the culture he and his brother hoped to implement is being upheld by the company's front-line employees.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Find Me a Home
programme.desc: Phil tries to help two families who have been made homeless, but is shocked by the terrible housing conditions so many people are forced to endure. Corvel and Meyrem are a hard-working couple from Southwark in London, who are being evicted from their one-bedroom cockroach and rat-infested flat, while Bibi and her 15-year-old son Oscar were evicted from the home they'd lived in for 15 years and have hit a brick wall when it comes to finding a new place.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Jackie is aghast to find Kelso has been canoodling with another girl behind the gym, and takes revenge by ensuring he is not invited to a skiing break at her father's cabin. Nostalgic comedy, starring Mila Kunis and Topher Grace.(n)

programme.title: Leap Year
programme.desc: A woman plans to take advantage of an Irish tradition to propose to her boyfriend while on holiday in Dublin. When they become separated, she faces a disastrous journey across the country in the company of a charming local innkeeper, and is tempted to leave her boyfriend for her travelling companion. Romantic comedy, starring Amy Adams, Matthew Goode and Adam Scott.(n)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: When Squidward swallows his clarinet reed, Sandy offers to retrieve the piece by shrinking herself and a mini sub down to microscopic proportions and traveling into Squid's body.(n)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: When Patrick mistakenly thinks he has to get out of town, SpongeBob helps to disguise his friend - so Patrick becomes Patricia, the prettiest new waitress at the Krusty Krab.(n)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants

programme.title: Finding Carter
programme.desc: Max decides to leave the Wilsons', Carter deals with a betrayal by Bird, while Lori is back - and she has a plan. Drama, starring Kathryn Prescott.(n)

programme.title: And Proud
programme.desc: Documentary examining the lifestyles of some of those living on benefits who are not currently seeking employment, including a Gloucestershire mother-of-11 who receives benefits equivalent to three times the typical UK family income. Also featured are a Liverpool couple who have not worked for six years, and two single mums in Camden whose rents are more than £1,200 a month each and are paid by the state.(n)

programme.title: Wentworth Prison
programme.desc: Channing threatens to close down the garden project, Jake takes steps to stop Will from exposing him, and Bridget gets a reprimand for drunkenness.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The town's big Easter egg hunt is placed in jeopardy when rumors surface that the Jewpacabra, a dangerous beast, is lurking in the woods nearby. Cartman tries to warn everyone that their lives are at risk if they participate in the egg hunt, but his protests are ignored until he produces video evidence of the creature's existence.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Stan plots to raise awareness about the dangers of bullying by filming a dance video, but struggles to handle the pressure that goes along with trying to take up such a noble cause.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Kenny's parents are arrested, leaving the put-upon youngster and his siblings at the mercy of the care system. Meanwhile, Cartman is bereft when his orange-hooded friend is taken away from school - mainly because he no longer has a poor classmate to make the butt of his jokes.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms

Meanwhile, Cathy is secretly preparing her own group - the Candy Apple Dancers - to up go against Abby's team in the forthcoming championship.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Kelly secretly hires choreographers to give Brooke and Paige an edge, and everyone is shocked when Cathy shows up with her rival dance school crew.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: A wrestling match brings out the worst in the guys. Nostalgic comedy, guest starring Dwayne Johnson as his own father Rocky Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Penelope
programme.desc: An heiress is born with the nose of a pig due to a curse on her family - an enchantment that can only be lifted by finding a man who loves her. As she reaches adulthood, her story piques the interest of a tabloid reporter, who, determined to get a photograph of her nose, hires a down-on-his-luck gambler for the task. However, the desperate hack fails to count on romance getting in the way. Romantic fantasy, starring Christina Ricci, James McAvoy and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.desc: SpongeBob fails his driving test and finds it difficult to be happy for Patrick when he has better luck.(n)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: An oversight in a royal genealogy document reveals that Patrick is the next in line to become a king, but it is not long before the power goes straight to the starfish's head.(n)

programme.desc: SpongeBob hears that a ferocious biker gang is coming to town, only no one seems bothered. So SpongeBob prepares to protect the town himself.(n)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Sonya is shaken by Willow's return, and fears her mother may also be back. The trolls come out in droves to abuse Piper online and Tyler is outraged on her behalf.(n)

programme.desc: Kat gets lessons in childcare from Marilyn, John goes on a road trip to his childhood home accompanied by Jet, while Zannis puts further temptation in Brody's way.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Kira desperately wants Kalani to compete against Maddie, but Abby does not want to risk Maddie losing, so she gives the other solo to Kendall.(n)

programme.title: The Butcher Surgeon: Why Wasn't He Stopped
programme.desc: Documentary profiling former breast surgeon Ian Paterson, who was recently convicted of intentionally wounding patients by performing needless operations for more than a decade. Paterson was found guilty on 17 counts, and this programme examines how was he able to continue for so long, asking whether his employers might have ignored or failed to act on a series of warnings stretching back to 2003. Some of Paterson's victims are also interviewed, along with health service whistleblowers.(n)

programme.title: When Kids Kill
programme.desc: Aaron Roach Bridgeman explores court restrictions and anonymity orders placed on child murderers, meaning the media cannot name perpetrators until the age of 18.(n)

programme.title: Soham Revisited: 15 Years On
programme.desc: Documentary examining events that took place in the small Cambridgeshire town which horrified the country. In December 2003, Iain Huntley, a caretaker at Soham Village College, was convicted of two murders and jailed for life. This film looks at the search for his victims, Huntley's arrest, and his subsequent trial and conviction.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.sub-title: I Should Have Never Gone Ziplining.
programme.desc: The boys eagerly anticipate spending a day ziplining in the Colorado Mountains. However, the trip takes a bad turn, and with no-one to turn to for help, their chances of surviving become slim.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: A new girl arrives at South Park Elementary, and everyone becomes preoccupied with finding out who she has a crush on. The occasion causes Cartman to discover something inside himself that he never knew he had, and he sets out to make sure nobody gets in the way of true love.(n)

programme.title: Corrina, Corrina
programme.desc: As Corrina draws Molly out of her shell, so Manny falls in love with her, but in 50s America, inter-racial relationships are still frowned on and the pair face prejudice from all sides as their relationship blossoms. The newcomer is a housekeeper-cum-nanny whose personality makes up for her want of domestic skills, but she is black, while Manny and his daughter are white, and in 1959 America the neighbours take a dim view of their blossoming relationship(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: Robert Zemeckis's comedy-adventure stars Kathleen Turner as reclusive best-selling writer Joan Wilder. When Joan receives a message from her sister saying she's been kidnapped in Colombia, she heads south to help her. Ending up stranded in the middle of nowhere, she bumps into adventurer Jack T Colton, who offers to help her. The two become involved in a search not only for her sister but also for a fabulous precious jewel. Hindering them are inept villains Ralph and Ira and a local bandit chief who happens to be Joan's number one fan..(n)

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: A blind retired army colonel hires a penniless student to look after him during a fateful weekend in New York City(n)

programme.title: Stealing Beauty
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old American Lucy arrives in Tuscany to visit her dead mother's friends... and to lose her virginity. Erotic drama from the director of Last Tango In Paris(n)

programme.title: Trapped
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, a young girl with asthma is kidnapped and held for ransom, but her captors tell her parents that they'll deprive the child of her medication unless they comply with their terms, one of which is not to contact the police(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: Life long Treasure Hunter, Benjamin Franklin Gates (Nicolas Cage) finally finds the clue to America's greatest national treasure. In this race against time action thriller Gates must elude the authorities and unlock the 2000-year old mystery(n)

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating a series of bank robberies initially suspect that the business's owner might be responsible, but they later realize that the heists point toward a much-larger conspiracy in this taut crime thriller(n)

programme.title: The Conspirator
programme.desc: Robert Redford's historical drama tells the story of Mary Surratt, who was put on trial for collusion in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln. Robin Wright plays Surratt, a widow whose boarding house was a meeting place for the conspirators and whose son John may have been involved in the plot. Surratt's initially reluctant defence lawyer is Frederick Aiken, whose doubts about taking on the case are gradually superseded by a conviction that Surratt is being used as a scapegoat. The cast also includes Evan Rachel Wood, Colm Meaney and Kevin Kline, and the performances and period detail are as impressive as could be expected of the talent involved. If the political stance of the film is a little simplistic, it's nevertheless a polished and thoughtful production(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: The powerful true story of Texas electrician Ron Woodroof, who was diagnosed as HIV positive in 1986, and subsequently devoted his life to providing unapproved drugs and supplements to fellow HIV patients during an era when doctors were still struggling to understand the virus(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: "Mad Max" sequel about survival in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Mel GIbson, Bruce Spence. Wez: Vernon Wells. Feral Kid: Emil Minty. Pappagallo: Mike Preston. Humungus: Kjell Nilsson. Warrior Woman: Virginia Hey. Curmudgeon: Syd Heylen. George Miller directed(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Kevin Costner stars in this epic western biopic chronicling the life of legendary lawman Wyatt Earp, from Dodge City to the shootout at the OK Corral(n)

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: Supernatural action fantasy based on the cult comic book Hellblazer. An ordinary man who can see both good and evil spirits in human guise tries to kill himself when his ability becomes too much for him. But he is saved from death, and must atone for his actions by becoming a guardian who banishes earthbound demons to Hell. When he meets a policewoman investigating the suspicious death of her sister, they are drawn into a desperate bid to save all humanity from evil(n)

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: Based on true events, a New York man and two accomplices are beseiged in a bank with all the bank employees after his attempt to rob enough money to pay for his male lover's sex change operation goes awry(n)

programme.title: In America
programme.desc: After chronicling various chapters of Irish history in such films as In the Name of the Father and The Field, writer/director Jim Sheridan turns his lens upon his own family's experiences immigrating to the United States in the aptly titled In America. The loosely autobiographical script centers on Johnny (Paddy Considine), a young actor sneaking his wife, Sarah (Samantha Morton), and daughters, Christy and Ariel (real-life sisters Sarah and Emma Bolger, respectively), over the Canadian border in the hopes of jump-starting his career in New York City. They soon find that America is not the land of boundless opportunity, however, as they move into a dank, dilapidated apartment building populated by drug dealers, transients, and thugs. Johnny doesn't snag auditions as easily as he may have hoped, and he and Sarah are forced to take meager jobs after spending their savings on food, rent, and utilities. Still in grief over the untimely death of their toddler son back in Ireland, the couple find their relationship further strained by the pressures of life in the city. Little by little, however, things begin to look up for the fiercely protective family unit, especially when they befriend an eccentric artist neighbor named Mateo (Djimon Hounsou). In America saw its world premiere at the 2002 Toronto International Film Festival and played to enthusiastic crowds at the 2003 Sundance Film Festival before its theatrical release in the fall of that year(n)

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: In this terrifying remake, a couple think they've found a dream house in Amityville, Long Island, but they soon learn that the home has a dark history. A year before, a man living in the house murdered his family in their sleep, claiming he was commanded to commit the crime by demons(n)

programme.title: The Hand that Rocks the Cradle
programme.desc: A widow poses as a nanny to seek revenge against a new mother, who does not know that their pasts are intertwined(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Trust no one. Deceive everyone. When idealistic CIA agent Roger Ferris (Di Caprio -- The Departed, Blood Diamond) is stationed in Jordan after being wounded in Iraq, he dedicates his life to stopping further attacks by Al Qaeda. Following a plan that the British employed successfully against the Nazis, Ferris plants the suspicion among the terrorists that their leaders are collaborating with the Americans. But as the stakes rise and Ferris finds himself in the crosshairs, the plot he starts spirals into an outcome he could never have foreseen(n)

The investigators recover bullets from the crime scene and match the casings to a gun registered to Hamilton, but the politician claims it was stolen during a break-in at his home. programme.desc: Part one of two. programme.desc: Sarah Porter, the new Secretary of the Navy, charges Gibbs and the team with finding terrorist group the Brotherhood of Doubt, which was responsible for killing her predecessor. programme.title: Animal Cops: Phoenix

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Face Ripper. Jeremy travels to Bolivia to investigate a report of a man whose face was severely injured by a freshwater creature(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Amazon Apocalypse. Jeremy retraces the path of a riverboat that sank in the Amazon River in 1981, and investigates the reasons why hundreds of passengers perished(n)

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Chainsaw Predator. Biologist and extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on a mission to find some of the world's most terrifying fish. In this episode, he goes to the Australian outback to try to catch the rare and fearsome freshwater sawfish, which can measure up to 18 feet long. Why does this shadowy sea monster travel hundreds of miles inland - and is it really a killer? Jeremy roams the beguiling landscape and encounters scientists and a real-life Crocodile Dundee before finally confronting the disturbing truth(n)

programme.title: The Crocodile Hunter
programme.desc: Wild River of Africa. Steve Irwin travels the Luangwa River in Zambia, observing hippos, Nile crocodiles and monitor lizards. Included: a crocodile feeding frenzy(n)

programme.desc: Miniature Bull Terrier, Dingo, English Setter, Borzoi, Wonder Dog, Keeshond. Meet unusual kinds of dogs including the gentle Borzoi being trained to help war veterans suffering post-traumatic stress disorders, a singing dingo, and the beautiful Keeshond(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Phoenix

programme.title: Animal Cops: Phoenix
programme.desc: Canal Dog Rescue. An injured dog is chased through a dry canal; trapped ducklings are returned to their mom; a tip is received about a cockfighting operation; a kitten gets a lucky break; a dog's future changes with an operation(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees

programme.title: Tanked

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Where the Wild Things Are. A KISS-theme tank for a miniature-golf course in Las Vegas is designed to look like a rock concert, complete with the band's logo and a light show; a pet-supplies retailer wants to celebrate its commitment to animals, and Wayde suggests saltwater and freshwater tanks, and a terrarium for snakes(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.sub-title: For Love of the Game...or Money?
programme.desc: For Love of the Game...or Money?. The guys are challenged to build a tank guarded by sharks inside a vault. Plus, can they create a bi-level Koi fish pond for NFL star Scott?(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: The Purr-fect Tank. Wayde and Brett build a tank for worldwide internet sensation Henri the Cat, and a 1500 gallon aquarium into the restaurant ceiling at the Royal Blues Hotel(n)

programme.title: Tanked

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martel Maxwell and Dion Dublin visit properties in Bilston, Wolverhampton, Nettlestead Green in Kent and Etruria in Stoke-on-Trent.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Police race to find two suspects when a young man is stabbed in Weston-super-Mare, while a brutal assault on a woman pushing a pram is caught on a bystander's phone in Bath.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate how a company sent one family to a succession of villas they had no right to stay in.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from Oswestry in Shropshire as two brothers compete against a couple to buy three items each to make the most profit at auction, with expert advice from Jonathan Pratt and John Cameron.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further coverage from SW19, where the last-eight of the ladies' singles draw is the main attraction of the day, including Johanna Konta v Simona Halep and Venus Williams v Jelena Ostapenko. British number one Konta came from a set down to beat Caroline Garcia in the previous round and will have to be at her best to defeat the second seed. Williams continues her bid to win her sixth Wimbledon singles title and her first since 2008, but this year's French Open champion, who is 17 years her junior, stands in her way. Other matches due to take place today include the quarter-finals in both the men's and ladies doubles competitions.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Angela Scanlon.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lauren struggles to tell Steven it is over between them, so she confides in Max, while Abi sees an opportunity to push the pair apart so she can finally get her claws into her sister's boyfriend. Denise tries - and fails - to tell Carmel she is not invited on the group holiday, and Patrick and Ted compete for the job of pot-washer at the Vic.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jac and Fran get the shock of their lives when someone from their past turns up at the hospital, while Raf is ribbed by Fletch, spotting that he likes Essie a bit more than he's letting on, and encourages him to give things another go. When Donna's old schoolmate is admitted, she soon realises how her life has been completely turned upside down, and she has to face her fears.(n)

programme.title: In the Dark
programme.desc: New series. As DI Helen Weeks grapples apprehensively with pregnancy, she is compelled to return to her loathed rural home town of Polesford, Derbyshire, with her partner and fellow detective Paul Hopkins. Two girls have been abducted and the man arrested is the husband of Helen's childhood best friend Linda Bates, who has been drawn into the centre of a media storm, while the local police force is under enormous pressure to get their man. But is he guilty? Crime drama adapted by Danny Brocklehurst from Mark Billingham's books, starring MyAnna Buring.(n)

programme.title: Grandad, Dementia & Me
programme.desc: Moving and intimate documentary following Tom Sivyer and his family after he is diagnosed with vascular dementia in 2014, filmed by his grandson Dominic. Shot over two years, the film captures Tom's rapid mental decline, and the attempts of his family to care for a once fiercely independent and proud man.(n)

programme.title: Mini Monet Millionaire
programme.desc: Martin Shaw narrates a profile of 14-year-old painter Kieron Williamson, who held his first show at the age of six and is already worth £2,000,000. With access to the Williamson household, this film follows Kieron's preparations for a major exhibition, revealing how his career is managed by his parents. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Denise Lewis and Dominic Littlewood help a young couple struggling to pay for their dream wedding, as they try to save enough money to finally make it up the aisle.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore terraced properties in Staffordshire and south Wales, and a small cottage in need of renovation on a large plot in Surrey. They then discover what they sold for at auction and speak to the new owners about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: The Weston-super-Mare force use CCTV to track a suspected burglar. Neighbours complain about a house in Bridgwater - and police believe drugs are at the heart of the problem.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: The difficulties in getting a refund when cancelling a holiday, even when the travel company sell it on to someone else. Plus, Simon Calder has tips for exploring the Greek islands.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces the opening coverage of day nine at the All England Club, and looks ahead to the matches due to take place today, as well as the latest news. Coverage continues on BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further coverage from SW19, where the men's quarter-final singles matches are due to take place. Two of the last-eight encounters at last year's tournament took place on Centre Court, the first of which saw seven-time champion Roger Federer face Marin Cilic, who was looking to progress to the semi-finals at the All England Club for the first time in his career. Sadly for the Croat, despite claiming the first two sets 7-6, 6-4, he would go on to lose a five-set thriller, as the Swiss battled back to claim the next three sets by scores of 6-3, 7-6 and 6-3 again. Following that epic battle, British number one Andy Murray took centre stage, and appeared to be sailing through to the last-four after taking a two-set lead against Jo-Wilfried Tsonga, only for the Frenchman to battle back and claim the next two sets himself, before Murray powered to victory by claiming the deciding set by a score of 6-1.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Martin Clunes joins Matt Baker and Alex Jones for a summer special live from Perranporth beach in Cornwall. Plus, live music by The Kooks.(n)

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: The team meets people whose vehicles have suddenly lost power in the middle of the road, and asks if one car giant's efforts to fix a problem are creating a more worrying concern. The results of hygiene tests into a business used by millions are revealed and the pressure sales techniques of a mobility furniture company are exposed.(n)

programme.title: The Week the Landlords Moved In
programme.desc: Birmingham landlord Samuel is just 25 but already has a portfolio of 13 properties worth more than £1million in total, and lives off the combined rental income with his wife Amanda. The couple spend a week living in one of their houses, rented by mother-of-two Marie, to experience life from her perspective. Also taking part are husband-and-wife duo Paul and Sharon from Weston-super-Mare, Somerset, who move into a two-bedroom flat rented by Chris and Courtney. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Room 101 - Extra Storage
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel show presented by Frank Skinner, with Rob Delaney, Davina McCall and Laurence Fox competing to have their pet hates consigned to Room 101, with topics including people who order starters, 12-string guitars and cyclists wearing Lycra.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Secrets
programme.desc: A look at the retailers' attempts to outdo one another in terms of convenience - one of the fastest-growing battlegrounds. Gregg Wallace discovers how supermarkets decide where to open small stores, while Babita Sharma travels to Spain on the trail of easy peel fruit. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Homes Under the Hammer presenter Martin Roberts talks to Brian Conley about his favourite TV shows from his childhood, including The Goodies, Trumpton and Call My Bluff.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: New series. Dominic Littlewood and Denise Lewis return to reveal more ways in which consumers can save money and manage their spending better, beginning by helping a widow.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: George Riley presents action from the latest fixtures, including Wakefield Trinity v Castleford Tigers, St Helens v Hull FC and Salford Red Devils v Leeds Rhinos.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Telford.
programme.desc: The building crusaders come to the aid of 12-year-old Matthew from Telford, who has been stuck in hospital for three years after suffering cancer and a stroke. The youngster's head teacher and school friends have been fundraising to get him home, so now, Nick Knowles and the team - with the help of hundreds of volunteers - set out to make Matthew's home suitable for his complex medical needs.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces the opening coverage of day eight at the All England Club, where the ladies' quarter-final singles matches are due to take place, including Garbine Muguruza v Svetlana Kuznetsova and Magdalena Rybarikova v Coco Vandeweghe. With pregnant 2016 champion Serena Williams absent and four of the top five seeds in Angelique Kerber, Karolina Pliskova, Elina Svitolina and Caroline Wozniacki all eliminated, the ladies' singles competition looks to be wide open, and the players who prevail today will feel they have every chance of going all the way.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the eighth day's play, where the line-up for the ladies' singles semi-finals was due to be decided, as the battle to succeed Serena Williams as champion continued. Plus, there's a round-up of the day's headlines, as well as a look ahead to the men's singles quarter-finals, which are scheduled to enthrall the crowds at SW19 tomorrow.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: How Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust is pushing the boundaries of what is possible technologically, at a time when the Trust has a planned annual deficit of £41 million and savings need to be made across the board. Meanwhile, at Charing Cross Hospital, site of the Trust's specialist neurosurgery department, 28-year-old former dancer Ben needs an operation to remove a recurrent brain tumour, and at Hammersmith, 23-year-old primary school teacher Rosa has an infection on her mitral valve called endocarditis.(n)

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Sophie seems to be making progress with her new friend at the library, while the club is visited by the mayor on a matter of some delicacy. Peter's quest to find his grandmother has attracted the attention of some old enemies and Andy spots something suspicious. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook, Toby Jones, Aimee-Ffion Edwards and Daniel Donskov.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Mark Urban.(n)

programme.title: Brexit Means Brexit: The Unofficial Version
programme.desc: Award-winning director Patrick Forbes goes beyond the headlines to film the battle to govern Britain, after last year's Referendum vote on 23rd June 2016. Filmed over one extraordinary year since the public voted to leave the European Union, it is a story of low politics, high ambition and bitter personal animosities, with the biggest decision the country has faced in decades at stake. Can the Prime Minister tame the judges, the opposition, and finally the public to deliver Brexit?.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: Daredevil Tennessee cowboy Blane and fun-loving Welsh office worker William trade places in an effort to find a new perspective on their lives. Both men are in their 20s and find themselves in a very similar predicament - they are about to take over the reins of their lucrative family businesses and must decide whether they want to commit to a path worked out for them, or follow their hearts and forge their own careers.(n)

programme.title: Me and My Dog: The Ultimate Contest
programme.desc: New series. Chris Packham hosts the show where dog owners and their pets compete in physical and mental challenges designed to test their ability to communicate, with trainers and canine scientists on hand to help them develop the relationship between human and animal. In the first episode, half the contestants must lead their dogs through a series of gates using verbal and physical signals, while the others must collect tennis balls in fast-flowing water. The final challenge sees the owners and dogs compete in a tethered biking challenge, to decide who has triumphed in the first stage of the contest.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Gyles Brandreth recalls the Queen's coronation and a groundbreaking political satire as he joins Brian Conley to choose the TV that shaped his life.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood and Denise Lewis help a family desperate to save enough cash to adapt their home for a wheelchair, with experts looking to curb their impulsive spending habits.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help two teams of couples find bargains at an antiques fair in the Royal Highland Centre in Edinburgh, with Anita Manning overseeing proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and South East chefs prepare their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and newcomer Andi Oliver, who are joined by Davis Cup captain Leon Smith. Together, they decide which contestant to send through to represent the region in the national finals.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: South West chefs Dominic Chapman, Tom Brown and Andy Clatworthy go all out to impress with their starters. Returning chef Dominic serves up a complex summer salad, while newcomer Tom worries his elegant dish may fail to impress the veteran judge, and Andy hopes his mushroom-centred dish will secure his place at the banquet.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Including coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons at 12.00. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces continued coverage of the men's quarter-final singles matches, which are expected to be the main focus of attention on day nine. Those in attendance on Number One Court of the corresponding day of last year's tournament witnessed two of the last-eight encounters to take place, beginning with Milos Raonic against Sam Querrey. While Raonic had previously appeared in a quarter-final match at SW19 in 2014, Querry had not previously progressed beyond the fourth round, and was aiming to continue his best-ever run at a Grand Slam event. Sadly for the American it was the Canadian who came out on top, eventually winning 6-4, 7-5, 5-7, 6-4 to set up a meeting with Roger Federer. The other contest between Tomas Berdych and Lucas Pouille proved to be a rather one-sided affair, with 2010 runner-up Berdych claiming a straight-sets victory over the inexperienced Frenchman. Other matches scheduled to take place today include the semi-finals of the ladies' doubles competition.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the day's play, where the line-up for the men's singles semi-finals was due to be decided. In addition to detailed analysis of those contests there's a round-up of the latest headlines, as well as a look ahead to the ladies' singles semi-finals, which are scheduled for Centre Court tomorrow.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to prune summer flowering shrubs, makes plans for autumn flowers and returns to Dublin to find out how Helen Dillon is progressing in her new garden. Joe Swift shows how good design should not hinder challenging conditions when he visits a garden in Kent, Rachel de Thame explores the vital role of scent in wild flowers and the insects that visit them, and Nick Bailey prepares designs for a weekend project that will transform a front garden into a beautiful and practical space. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Guests Miles Jupp, Deirdre O'Kane and Phill Jupitus join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme `non sequiturs'. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by James O'Brien.(n)

programme.desc: How Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust is pushing the boundaries of what is possible technologically, at a time when the Trust has a planned annual deficit of £41 million and savings need to be made across the board. Meanwhile, at Charing Cross Hospital, site of the Trust's specialist neurosurgery department, 28-year-old former dancer Ben needs an operation to remove a recurrent brain tumour, and at Hammersmith, 23-year-old primary school teacher Rosa has an infection on her mitral valve called endocarditis.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Handmade: By Royal Appointment
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating handcrafted objects made under the royal warrant, beginning by following the creation of a Wedgwood panther vase by artisan potters. The programme also takes a look at how this quintessentially British company is reinventing itself for the 21st century under new, foreign ownership.(n)

programme.title: Britain Beneath Your Feet
programme.desc: In the second of a two-part documentary about the fascinating world down below, Dallas Campbell reveals what goes on underground to keep the country on the move. He meets the hidden army of workers who keep Britain running, from the drivers of the largest tunnelling machines in the world to the engineers running a vast power station beneath a mountain in Wales. He also discovers how a secret wartime pipeline is now delivering fuel to Heathrow Airport, and helps to relocate a group of badgers who are threatening the foundations of a primary school.(n)

programme.title: The British Garden: Life and Death on Your Lawn
programme.desc: Chris Packham and a group of experts spend 12 months scrutinising the wildlife in eight gardens on a suburban street in Welwyn Garden City. Throughout the seasons they find male crickets that bribe females with food during sex, spiders that change colour to help catch prey, and ferocious life-and-death battles in the compost heap. They also shows a different side to familiar garden residents, revealing how a robin's red breast is actually war paint, and a single litter of foxes can have up to five different fathers.(n)

programme.title: Deep, Down and Dirty - The Science of Soil
programme.desc: Gardening expert Chris Beardshaw explores where soil comes from, and what it is made of. It is an often misunderstood substance, with people sometimes dismissing it as dirt, so he reveals it as it has never been seen before using specialist microphotography, and highlights what makes it so essential to life. Research shows that humans are pushing this precious resource to its limit, and scientists are battling to find ways of preserving it for the future.(n)

programme.title: The Brits Who Built the Modern World
programme.desc: A look at the 1980s when contemporary architecture was unpopular and under attack from the Prince of Wales. British architects discuss the stories behind their most famous creations including Richard Rogers' Lloyd's of London building and Norman Foster's Stansted Airport. Terry Farrell reveals how he was kept in the dark while working on the MI6 Headquarters, and Michael Hopkins recalls the challenges of bringing modern design into the traditional world of Lord's Cricket Ground.(n)

programme.title: Medieval Lives: Birth, Marriage, Death
programme.desc: Historian Helen Castor explores marriage in the Middle Ages, revealing how family and friends were often heavily involved in bringing two individuals together. She also discovers how the Catholic Church tried to impose controls on matrimony after the ability to hold a wedding almost anywhere had led to a free-for-all, driven by the unpredictable human emotions of love and lust.(n)

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby sails along the coast of East Anglia, exploring how Britain's view of the sea has changed over the past 200 years. The coast and the beach became a playground for the nation, inspiring artists, transforming coastal architecture and creating a seaside culture that remains uniquely British. Setting out from Gorleston-on-Sea, he travels down the Suffolk and Essex coasts and into the Thames, until he reaches Greenwich. Along the way he discovers works of art that reflect Britain's evolving relationship with the sea, meets a sand sculptor and visits the Queen's House in Greenwich, built in 1616 as a waterside retreat for Queen Anne and now home to Britain's greatest collection of maritime artefacts. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The British Garden: Life and Death on Your Lawn
programme.desc: Chris Packham and a group of experts spend 12 months scrutinising the wildlife in eight gardens on a suburban street in Welwyn Garden City. Throughout the seasons they find male crickets that bribe females with food during sex, spiders that change colour to help catch prey, and ferocious life-and-death battles in the compost heap. They also shows a different side to familiar garden residents, revealing how a robin's red breast is actually war paint, and a single litter of foxes can have up to five different fathers.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Handmade: By Royal Appointment
programme.desc: A look at the work of shoemakers John Lobb, which has produced hand-crafted footwear for gentlemen since the 19th century and boasts Royal Warrants from Prince Philip and Prince Charles. The company uses methods that have barely changed since it was founded, from pencilled outlines on brown paper, to the cutting and stitching of leather and the final polishing. Zoe Wanamaker narrates.(n)

programme.title: Hunting the Nazi Gold Train
programme.desc: In August 2015 two amateur researchers declared they had found a lost Nazi train buried in a railway cutting near Walbrzych in Silesia, southern Poland. This followed decades of local folklore that a train, loaded with gold, had vanished after leaving Wroclaw in early 1945. Dan Snow follows the treasure hunters as they embark on the hunt, while also investigating this extraordinary story that leads all the way to Adolf Hitler himself and his secret plans for this remote corner of the Third Reich during the closing months of the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: Sound Waves: The Symphony of Physics
programme.desc: Helen Czerski investigates the science behind familiar sounds as well as those humans cannot hear. At the Palace of Westminster, she teams up with scientists to carry out measurements using state-of-the-art lasers to reveal how Big Ben vibrates to create pressure waves in the air at particular frequencies. She also explores the science of the voice, inviting soprano Lesley Garrett to sing I Dreamed A Dream inside an MRI scanner to reveal how her vocal tract acts as a resonator, amplifying and shaping the sound from her larynx.(n)

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines the introduction of precise railway schedules and timetables that recognised Greenwich Mean Time. However, in a country made up of separate local time zones, with clocks in the west set several minutes behind those in the east, not everyone was keen to step in line.(n)

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines how the railways stimulated great changes to the nation's economy, and encouraged a new generation of mechanical engineers, skilled workers, managers and accountants. Originally, local entrepreneurs viewed trains as vehicles for shifting raw materials, stock and goods, however it soon became clear that there was money to be made in transporting people.(n)

programme.title: Patagonia with Huw Edwards
programme.desc: The newsreader follows in the footsteps of settlers who travelled from Wales to Patagonia 150 years ago with the intention of creating a colony where their language and culture would endure. On arrival in South America, Huw meets descendants of the original immigrants and examines how much of their spirit lives on in the present.(n)

It transpires the bomber was stabbed before the explosion - and Horatio's supposedly dead half-brother could have been involved.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Part two of two. Matt is reunited with a man whose life he once saved, only to find he is sending secret messages to a band of outlaws. Guest starring Slim Pickens (Dr Strangelove).(n)

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: A plastic surgeon accused of murdering his business partner turns out to have an identical twin. Guest starring Patricia Heaton (Everybody Loves Raymond).(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: A woman sues the father of her son for the balance on a motorcycle; he claims he sold the vehicle to a friend without handing over the pink slip.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: The whereabouts of $3,000 from an accident settlement is disputed when a woman claims her ex-boyfriend stole the money. He claims they used it on joint living expenses.(n)

programme.title: Papa's Angels
programme.desc: A man struggling to come to terms with the loss of his wife is faced with the prospect of a harsh mountain winter. He decides to keep the children home from school in an attempt to give them time to overcome their grief together. Drama, starring Scott Bakula, Cynthia Nixon and Eva Marie Saint.(n)

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: Monica works as an assistant teacher to Mike who, after 20 years, is questioning his career. Two former students, now hoodlums, kidnap Mike in order to steal his boat. Drama, starring Roma Downey.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: After allegedly being ambushed, assaulted with a crow bar and kicked in the face, a teenager denies sleeping with another girl's boyfriend.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Allegations of strong marijuana, sexual harassment, and goat water come into play when a make-up artist sues the director of an action film set in Antigua for lost wages.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: An 8-year-old boy is accused of assaulting another child in a school bathroom and knocking out his teeth; he claims he was verbally bullied and provoked first.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: A basketball coach takes the law into his own hands when a 6' 6' tall, 17-year-old player steals money from another team member because he thought his iPod had been stolen.(n)

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Bev fights for her life on the hospital wing following her heroin overdose, as governor Frances Myers vows to stop the drug-dealers, and Jim is haunted by his murderous actions.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 313. Products include an elevated monorail bike system from the inventor of Rollerblades; accessories that convert shoes into boots; a custom-made air mattress; and customized cruiser bikes. Also: an update on a towel designed for modesty when changing(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 613. A Brooklyn man tries to spark interest in his family-run business of foldable, wheeled luggage; a Houston woman has a line of soaps and grooming products to pitch; a couple from Sapulpa, Okla., show off their gameday apparel for women; and a Scarsdale, N.Y., entrepreneur gives the Sharks a taste of his single-serve wine that comes in recyclable plastic. Also: Lori Greiner offers an update on her "All-Stars."(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 714. An entrepreneur from Mill Valley, Cal., uses a surprising labor force to create her product; a college student from San Diego offers the Sharks a chance to try a grown-up version of a favorite childhood toy; and beauty industry experts from New York City pitch their innovations. Also: an update on a line of plush slippers invested in by Robert Herjavec during Season 5(n)

programme.title: The Profit
programme.desc: Bodhi Leaf Coffee Traders. A California entrepreneur saw early success after starting a coffee business with no prior experience, but soon suffered from as lack of organization and leadership as well as staff problems, and enlists Marcus to help turn things around(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 525. Kevin O'Leary critiques a light and healthy wine pitched by a California woman; and Robert Herjavec has some suggestions for a former merchant marine who runs a treasure-hunting operation. Also: The Sharks consider investing in cinnamon rolls and a collapsible kayak; and there's an update on a food truck backed by Barbara Corcoran during Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 529. programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen's husband Stan dies in the middle of their divorce proceedings, leaving her to contend with the problem of his will, which is complicated by the appearance of his mistress Lorraine. Guest starring Minnie Driver and Harry Connick Jr.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: The foursome goes on a yachting trip to the Caribbean to scatter Stan's ashes, while Leo flies to Guatemala with an attractive female colleague. Guest starring Minnie Driver, Harry Connick Jr, Deborah Harry and Nicollette Sheridan.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: An offhand comment to the twins' new friend has dire consequences for Ray, who cannot understand why everyone is so upset - but he compounds his error by accidentally repeating the remark to the boy's father. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank puts salt on Marie's home-made lasagne, causing her to think she is turning into a terrible cook, but Ray and Robert discover their father has lost his sense of taste - apparently because of a potency medication he is taking. Comedy, starring Peter Boyle, Doris Roberts, Ray Romano and Brad Garrett.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz prepares to leave the radio station - but not before airing her views about Frasier's relationship with Julia. Meanwhile, Niles and Daphne take the plunge and decide to start a family.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Despite having quit her job twice, Roz returns to work at KACL as if nothing has happened, while Niles and Daphne invest in a variety of scientific gadgets to find the best time to conceive. Starring Kelsey Grammer and Peri Gilpin.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: A Man, a Plan and a Gal - Julia.
programme.desc: Julia attends a party with Frasier, where she manages to offend the entire Crane family by blurting out the news that Daphne is pregnant. Comedy, guest starring Felicity Hunter, with Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mike Bloom, president and COO of discount retail chain Family Dollar, intends to double its number of stores within a few years. He decides that to do so he first needs to go incognito within the organisation to monitor where the firm is excelling and where it needs improvement.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Kerry Herbert from Brighton has dreamed of buying a property on Grenada since she visited the Caribbean island as a child. With her teenage son about to fly the nest and after dealing with the loss of her father, she has decided to take the plunge and buy somewhere that she, her son and her partner can enjoy. Jonnie Irwin helps shows her five properties - but it remains to be seen whether any of them will tempt Kerry to make an offer.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In the Lake District, Paul and Glenda kick off the competition in their static caravan, but eyebrows are raised at his unromantic approach to his relationship. On day two self-confessed gadget geek David and his partner Jane show their competitive side with a confidently presented, well-received meal. Finally outdoorsy twentysomethings Matt and Polly show off their `good life' approach to cooking with a home-grown feast.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Larry from Cashbrokers in Penzance goes to look at some antique petrol pumps, while in south-east London childhood sweethearts want to pawn their jewellery to fund a family reunion.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, featuring historian Suzannah Lipscomb in Dictionary Corner alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Karen and John Leonard from Essex are close to retirement and fancy a new home in sunny Gran Canaria. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties for their £175,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps Louisa and Paul, who want more family time together in Surrey, and newlyweds Dee and Matt, who want to leave Tamworth town centre and move to the countryside.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts check in to the Thomas Paine Hotel in Thetford, where an inappropriate book is found in a bedside drawer and competition turns fierce at a Home Guard training exercise.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: As the competition continues in Belfast, hairbrush executive Julie hopes to charm her way to the prize with an evening of fusion food inspired by her time in Japan and Hong Kong.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer becomes a member of the paparazzi, and proves so successful at snapping embarrassing photographs that his celebrity victims seek revenge on him for exposing their indiscretions.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Darren and Nancy go to visit Kyle, but Nancy is worried about his welfare, while Tom and Alfie get the wrong end of the stick at The Loft and Courtney makes a big decision.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Chef Michel Roux Jr and a panel of food experts blind taste-test some of the nation's favourite food and drink. Joining the host is restaurant manager and First Dates' Fred Sirieix, journalist, broadcaster and critic Jay Rayner, baker and deli owner Stacie Stewart, and TV presenter and foodie mum Lucy Alexander. The panel this week choose between four different brands of steak and ale pie, houmous and sauvignon blanc - the UK's most popular wine. Plus, the quick-fire public test is for cola drinks.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: The team investigates big-brand baby foods and finds some unexpected ingredients, while Fairy Original's longer-lasting claim is put to the test. Anna Richardson and Andi Osho check out if readers' offers are really as good as they sound and look into the high street in-store experiences that tempt us to spend again.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Find Me a Home
programme.desc: Phil tries to help two families who have been made homeless, but is shocked by the terrible housing conditions so many people are forced to endure. Corvel and Meyrem are a hard-working couple from Southwark in London, who are being evicted from their one-bedroom cockroach and rat-infested flat, while Bibi and her 15-year-old son Oscar were evicted from the home they'd lived in for 15 years and have hit a brick wall when it comes to finding a new place.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Nahida from Liverpool is searching for a man who shares her passion for food, and her date is with fellow Liverpudlian Thomas, who describes himself as a loveable bear. Ex-cruise ship worker Dale, 46, has been single for five years since his partner passed away, but is now ready to put his faith in Cupid again, and his date is 39-year-old massage therapist Chris.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 58-year-old woman is brought into the hospital after being run over by a lorry, suffering severe blood loss. Doctors are concerned that nerves and tissue in her leg may have suffered irreparable damage. Meanwhile, a 65-year-old man is treated after falling from a loft ladder, and a mischievous 85-year-old shows signs of severe dehydration.(n)

programme.title: Sound and Vision
programme.desc: New series. Journalist and broadcaster Billie JD Porter fronts a new four-part documentary series that looks at socially conscious icons in contemporary music.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: Icebergs explode into thousands of pieces in Antarctica, locals film a rare snowstorm in the Saudi Arabian desert, and more than 10,000 seabirds are killed off the north-west coast of America when storms churn up algae in the waters, creating deadly sea foam. In Canada, tourists witness a full-circle rainbow, and a firefighter in Texas is caught up in a wave of hail so large that it shuts down the highway.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Young TV viewers give their honest, inimitable and hilarious take on This Morning and Doctor Who, and sing along to The Sound of Music.(n)

programme.title: Weekend
programme.desc: A gay man trying to make sense of his life leaves a party with his friends and goes to a nightclub in search of a one-night stand. He and the man he takes home that night end up spending the weekend together, and begin to realise that their developing relationship may be just what was missing in their lives. Romantic drama, starring Tom Cullen and Chris New.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: The host helps three couples struggling to sell their properties in Liverpool, including one who do not see eye to eye about their lounge and Dynasty-style dining room. Previously seen on More4.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples from Gloucestershire who are looking for properties to reflect the change of direction their lives have taken. Cosmopolitan couple Mel and Jon hope to adopt a child, and are looking for a family home in the Cotswolds, while Isobel and Chris are soon to be married, and want to buy their first house together.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, featuring historian Suzannah Lipscomb in Dictionary Corner alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Leo's fidelity is called into question when Grace finds a love letter in his bag, while Jack and Will wake up sharing a bed, but cannot remember the night before. Harry Connick Jr guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Leo invites his trendy ex-girlfriend to a dinner party. Grace asks Will, Jack and Karen to come along and keep the night running smoothly, but the guest of honour turns out to be the only girl Will ever slept with. Meanwhile, Lorraine's dog is discovered hiding in Stan's closet. Guest starring Mira Sorvino.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Amy chats non-stop through a basketball game, and Ray responds by suggesting to Robert that she talks too much - a criticism she does not take well. Comedy, starring Monica Horan and Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra cannot understand why Ray keeps turning down her advances - not realising that playing it cool is all part of his latest devious plan to get what he wants. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Alistair Burke, the cultured conductor of the Seattle Opera, becomes convinced Frasier is gay, a misunderstanding the shrink decides to cultivate after his misinformed suitor begins to shower him with gifts. Guest starring Patrick Stewart.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin and Frasier vie for the affections of the boys' former babysitter, and the shrink becomes depressed when his father wins her love. Luckily, his ability to solve several mind-twisting problems puts him in a better mood. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz persuades Frasier to go on a date with her friend - but the arrangement turns out to be a disaster. Niles and Daphne suspect their maid is dishonest.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Travis Boersma, co-founder and president of one of the largest privately owned drive-through coffee shop chains in America, goes undercover to learn whether the culture he and his brother hoped to implement is being upheld by the company's front-line employees.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi searches the Kissimmee area of Florida to find a holiday home suitable for mother and daughter Jane and Bethan Thomas, who wish to buy a place close by the sunshine state's theme parks that they adore so much. Within their £70,000 budget, the options include a two-bedroom apartment and a three-bedroom lakeside house that offers a promising rental return.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Wiltshire, civil partners Andrew and David serve up a `ritzy' affair for their guests, but their food gets a mixed reaction. On the second night, hosts Emma and Richard face a grilling over their use of shop-bought ingredients. Meanwhile, Richard and Joey's `bromance' develops when they feed each other heart-shaped strawberries. Last to host are newlyweds Joey and Hannah, who serve basic wholesome food, but argue over the size of their fishcakes.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Nathan and Debb test-drive an unusual motorcycle simulator at Pickwick Pawnbrokers, while Larry and Neil look to complete deals involving a rare drum kit, a luxury set of travel bags and an antique medicine cabinet at Cashbrokers in Penzance.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, featuring historian Suzannah Lipscomb in Dictionary Corner alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Renuka Joseph is looking for a home on the Costa del Sol, which reminds her of her native Sri Lanka, so Jasmine Harman shows her apartments in Estepona for her £80,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Belfast, mobile barista Justin hosts the latest dinner party, hoping his barbecue extravaganza will wow the guests, with even the dessert to be toasted on the coals.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brazilian football legend Ronaldo visits the town to advise Homer on refereeing Little League matches, while Marge reacts to accusations of technophobia by purchasing a PC - and soon becomes hooked on a game involving a virtual Springfield being terrorised by Bart.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Tom and Alfie cover for Darren, while Armstrong acts as Cindy's protector, and Holly gets a shock when she receives a letter from Jude inviting her and Nick to Ibiza. Holly confides in Ellie and invites her to take Nick's place.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Ackley Bridge
programme.desc: Mandy's personal and professional lives collide with one another when Alya reveals her and Sadiq's affair at the school's first Open Day. As Mandy fights for her job, but chooses to put her pupils before her career, Steve comes to her rescue. Will it be enough to repair their relationship? Meanwhile, Candice discloses the true identity of Jamie's father, leading Jordan to spiral out of control. Chloe gets caught up in Jordan's plans to leave Ackley Bridge, only for them to fall foul of the police. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 36-year-old man is rushed to St George's after being involved in a high-speed road traffic collision, with CT scans revealing a potentially life-threatening injury to his spleen. Meanwhile, a 21-year-old who dislocated his finger scoring the winning points in a basketball match believes his trip to A&E is the perfect subject for one of his vlogs.(n)

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: Reliving his clubbing heyday, Harry buys a nightclub and asks Kate to be the DJ, while Beatrice and Eugenie work the door. Charles introduces lizards into his garden as pest control, but things get out of hand, and Wills needs to complete his helicopter training.(n)

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Nicki is arrested in connection with Ray's death and is questioned by Chief Dammik, who suspects that she killed him in retaliation for abuse, while Gloria asks Winnie to tell Emmit about his brother and gauge his reaction. Black comedy drama, starring Ewan McGregor and Carrie Coon.(n)

programme.title: Catching a Killer
programme.sub-title: Catching a Killer: The Wind in the Willows Murder.
programme.desc: In April last year, 42-year-old antiquarian book dealer Adrian Greenwood was found dead in his home, having been stabbed more than 30 times in a frenzied and brutal attack - with no suspects, no witnesses and no sign of forced entry. This documentary follows the work of the Thames Valley Police Major Crime Unit as Det Supt Kevin Brown and his team embark on their investigation into who killed Greenwood, as well as find out what happened to the victim's early edition of The Wind in the Willows, worth £50,000.(n)
