programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister and Rimmer finally arrive back on Earth, only to discover they have slipped through a time hole into a period where everything occurs backwards. Cult space comedy, starring Chris Barrie and Craig Charles.(n)

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.sub-title: Blackadder the Third: Dish and Dishonesty.
programme.desc: Devious royal butler Edmund Blackadder steps in to foil a plan by new prime minister Pitt the Younger to bankrupt his master the Prince Regent - but as usual his intentions are not particularly honourable. Rowan Atkinson, Hugh Laurie and Tony Robinson star.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple have their first lovers' tiff and Gavin is so beside himself with worry he drives all the way to Barry Island to resolve things. Stacey finally agrees to return to Billericay with her beau, prompting his proud mum Pamela to set about cleaning the house from top to bottom. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Danny Bhoy, Miles Jupp and Lee Nelson.
programme.desc: Danny Bhoy hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, warming up the audience before introducing routines by actor-comedian Miles Jupp and happy-go-lucky chancer Lee Nelson, aka Simon Brodkin.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy agrees to marry Nancy to make her eligible for a visa, and while the would-be bride insists it is purely an administrative procedure, Mark is not sure his friend views the ceremony the same way. Comedy, starring David Mitchell and Robert Webb.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The four students decide to throw a party, but before long it descends into chaos. Rick desperately tries to impress his favourite lecturer, Mike chats up a fairytale princess, Vyvyan's fellow punks start a riot, and Neil gets beaten up, while other guests include the four horsemen of the Apocalypse, a giant sandwich, a singing tomato and Santa. Comedy first broadcast in 1982, starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson, with music by Rip Rig and Panic.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Danny Bhoy, Miles Jupp and Lee Nelson.
programme.desc: Danny Bhoy hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, warming up the audience before introducing routines by actor-comedian Miles Jupp and happy-go-lucky chancer Lee Nelson, aka Simon Brodkin.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: Skits and sketches from comedy duo Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders, including a parody of Bjork and their version of Braveheart. Guest starring Patsy Kensit and Mel and Sue.(n)

programme.title: Big School
programme.desc: Miss Postern organises a school trip to France so naturally Mr Church is keen to tag along. However, there are no places left, so he resorts to bribery to book a place on the coach. But once he gets the woman of his dreams across the Channel, will it be a case of ooh la la, or oh no no? David Walliams and Catherine Tate star in the classroom sitcom.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: The comedy duo present a parody of Federico Fellini's movies. Featuring Kate Moss and Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Emily Howard is joined by a new friend, who proves equally unconvincing when it comes to cross-dressing, while Sebastian continues to lust after the hapless Prime Minister. Featuring guest appearances by Vanessa Feltz, Geraldine James and Ruth Madoc, who plays the mother of long-suffering gay Welshman Dafydd. Narrated by Tom Baker.(n)

programme.desc: MI5 use Peter's home as a safe house for a Russian defector, leaving him with a major diplomatic incident on his hands.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: The agents make a disastrous mistake during a mission, but a college lecturer helps to salvage the situation.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's suspicions about Paul's bad influence seem to be confirmed when he spots a half-naked woman in next door's back garden. Comedy, starring Richard Briers. First broadcast February 12, 1984.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon finds a baby, and Carole's ex-husband pays a visit.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An upset Howard becomes convinced he was abandoned as a baby after a few well-chosen words from Clegg, while Alvin is equally distraught that his newly constructed kite will not fly. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly spots a bottle with a message inside floating down the river, and decides to catch it - so enlists the help of Clegg, Billy and Alvin to follow its elusive course and eventually read the mysterious contents. Long-running comedy, starring Frank Thornton, Peter Sallis, Keith Clifford and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The arrival of Clegg's cousin threatens to spell the end of the gang's gentle walks, so they resolve to get rid of him. Aubrey finds he can still beat Billy and Alvin cycling up hills, but discovers his own weakness. Starring Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's suspicions about Paul's bad influence seem to be confirmed when he spots a half-naked woman in next door's back garden. Comedy, starring Richard Briers. First broadcast February 12, 1984.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon finds a baby, and Carole's ex-husband pays a visit.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright feels neglected by Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, and decides to elicit her undivided attention by feigning illness. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Local election fever hits the village and Geraldine finds she is a more popular candidate with the voters than over-confident parish council chairman David. Richard Curtis's comedy, starring Dawn French and Gary Waldhorn.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Prudish Basil resorts to increasingly desperate measures to prevent an unmarried couple lowering moral standards at his hotel. Unfortunately, as his efforts become increasingly frantic, he succeeds only in making a fool of himself. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An upset Howard becomes convinced he was abandoned as a baby after a few well-chosen words from Clegg, while Alvin is equally distraught that his newly constructed kite will not fly. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly spots a bottle with a message inside floating down the river, and decides to catch it - so enlists the help of Clegg, Billy and Alvin to follow its elusive course and eventually read the mysterious contents. Long-running comedy, starring Frank Thornton, Peter Sallis, Keith Clifford and Brian Murphy.(n)

Unfortunately, as his efforts become increasingly frantic, he succeeds only in making a fool of himself. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: David Jason stars in this follow-up to Roy Clarke's popular comedy Open All Hours. Once the dogsbody, Granville has inherited the business from his miserly uncle Albert Arkwright, but he is not alone in running the shop - he now has his own assistant in the shape of his son Leroy, who proves more popular with the ladies than his dad ever did. It's a typical day at the grocer's as Granville tries to get a date with old flame Mavis without her terrifying sister Madge finding out, while Leroy shuns the old delivery bike in favour of an altogether more attractive way to take out the orders. James Baxter and Lynda Baron co-star, with appearances by Johnny Vegas, Mark Williams, Brigit Forsyth, Nina Wadia and Sally Lindsay.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Jean vents her anger on the customers, while Tony considers asking Bren to accompany him on a trip to Marbella. Petula returns with interesting news, and Anita celebrates the second week of her relationship with Pedro. Victoria Wood stars.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement, prompting the Shipmans to throw a party in Billericay. Even Bryn's decision to use his sat-nav for the journey fails to dampen their spirits, and everything goes swimmingly until the conversation turns to money - and the sweethearts drop a bombshell. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jack Dee, Jason Manford & Russell Howard.
programme.desc: Jack Dee hosts the stand-up show from London's Hammersmith Apollo, with guest comedians Jason Manford and Russell Howard. Between them, the trio regale the audience with their thoughts on the polar ice-caps, wimpy professional footballers, canine funerals, internet dating and muggers.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark is distraught after being mugged by two teenagers, and becomes oblivious to Sophie's advances. Jeremy faces a moral dilemma as he waits for the return of his girlfriend, but is offered a threesome. Comedy, starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Michel Roux Jr oversee proceedings as six chefs battle it out in the quarter-final, preparing a dish of their own invention from a range of ingredients including oysters, whelks, mangos, white chocolate and dates. Only four contestants will make it to the next challenge, in which they have to cook two courses for food critics William Sitwell, Tracey MacLeod and Jay Rayner - with two going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 10 remaining amateur cooks' tart-making abilities are put to the test in the third round of the competition. Their first task is to bake a tarte Tatin, with judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry looking for intriguing flavour combinations to tickle their tastebuds. The hopefuls then face another daunting technical challenge as they try to replicate Mary's seemingly straightforward recipe for treacle tart, but the delicate task of adding a lattice top leaves some contestants flummoxed. Finally, they try to create an ornate fruit tart fit for gracing the window display of a leading patisserie - before discovering the identities of the latest Star Baker and the person who will be heading home. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The last quarter-final sees the four heat winners take on the fiendishly difficult palate test, recreating John Torode's Singapore chilli crab, having only had a couple of minutes to taste the dish and write down what they think the ingredients are. It's a tricky recipe with a fiery chilli and black-bean paste that also requires them to prepare and cook a whole crab. Can they rise to the challenge? They then rustle up a showstopping dish for the judges and food critic Kate Spicer, before finding out who has made it through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: Sweet Baby James
programme.desc: Chef James Martin returns to his secondary school, Malton, where he failed his cookery GCSE, in this week's back-to-basics-themed episode. He visits Morfudd Richards to discover the secret of her home-made organic ice-creams taking the market by storm, and meets the couple who found success by introducing crumble recipes into French cooking.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King explore the history behind the boom in pub food, tracing it from the humble beginnings of bar snacks and chicken-in-a-basket to the birth of the gastro pub. The duo also recreate some mouthwatering dishes that would make any publican proud.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits Mumbai in search of the bombil, the fish used in Bombay duck, and also enjoys Parsee hospitality and learns about their contribution to Indian cuisine. He then travels south to Pondicherry, where locals prepare Indian dishes with a French twist, before heading north along the coast to Mamallapuram to sample one of the best fish curries he has ever had. Rick also demonstrates how to make popular Parsee chicken dish sali murgh and personal favourite aloo mattar.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: Part one of two. The chef moves on to South Australia, where he cooks in a Vietnamese restaurant and tries to put a modern twist on roast chicken.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: After four weeks of competition the semi-finals begin, and the eight remaining contenders must prepare a dish to impress judge Gregg Wallace. They have just two hours to demonstrate their skill, flair and ability to deliver perfect flavours and immaculate presentation, with only the six best chefs progressing to the next stage.(n)

programme.title: Destination Flavour Japan
programme.desc: Adam Liaw visits the Hokuriku region, uncovering the secrets to superb sake, sampling sushi and preparing a classic Japanese dish with his mother-in-law.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood assess the remaining contestants' dessert-making skills. The hopefuls start by creating tortes before tackling this week's technical test - the delicate French dish of creme caramel. Though these two rounds provide a stern examination of the amateurs' creative flair and technical ability, they then face possibly the toughest task of the series so far - a six-hour challenge to create a show-stopping layered meringue. Once the sugar has set, who will be this week's Star Baker, and who will be going home? Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After five weeks of heats, 60 hopefuls have been whittled down to the most promising 10. But if they thought it was tough getting this far, the knockout stage will really sort the dishwashers from the chefs, as over the next two nights the remaining contestants are split into two groups of five and get their first taste of professional cooking. Tonight's group heads to London's Caxton Grill, where 2013 MasterChef: The Professionals finalist Adam Handling is head chef for a busy lunchtime service. Then it's back to the studio to rustle up a dish from an array of seasonal produce for renowned chef Marcus Wareing and the judges, John Torode and Gregg Wallace, who will then send one of the hopefuls home.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore how the seasonality of Britain's weather has forced people to devise ingenious ways of storing food through the winter months, revealing that tasty dishes have evolved from a need to preserve.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits the town of Madurai in Tamil Nadu, where he learns the art of temple cooking and samples south Indian dish sambar. He then takes a road trip across the Western Ghats to the state of Kerala, where he prepares regional dessert payasam and a traditional pork curry.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: Part two of two. Adelaide is the next stop for the chef, who considers what makes a first-class burger and hunts down freshwater yabbies on the coast.(n)

programme.title: The Therapist
programme.desc: Prodigy. In the Season 1 finale, rapper Prodigy of Mobb Deep discusses living with sickle-cell anemia and receiving supernatural spiritual messages(n)

programme.title: Funny How?

Edward James Olmos, Jon Seda, Constance Marie, Jacob Vargas, Jackie Guerra, Rebecca Lee Meza, Lupe Ontiveros(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: A dystopian fantasy adventure based on an unusually faithful adaptation of the highly regarded graphic novel by Alan Moore, directed by Zach Snyder. It is 1985 and Richard Nixon continues his tenure in the White House, massively popular with the electorate following his crushing defeat of the Viet Cong. However, it seems that the American public have fallen out of love with their superheroes, one of whom, Dr Manhattan, was largely responsible for the winning the Vietnam War. Now, he and his fellow crime-fighters are regarded as reprehensible vigilantes and have been banned by law. But, when one of their number - the vile, ironically named Comedian - is murdered, the former heroes begin to re-emerge from the shadows to investigate. They discover that a terrifying plan is afoot... Also starring Matthew Goode, Malin Akerman, Patrick Wilson and Jackie Earle Haley(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2005 musical stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music and dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show?(n)

programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2005 musical stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music and dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show?(n)

programme.title: Babylon A.D.
programme.desc: In the near-future, tough mercenary Toorop is hired to transport a girl from Russia to New York, unaware that she is believed by some to be the new messiah. Sci-fi(n)

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire Lebowski, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: When a woman buys an apartment fitted with a 'panic room', a state-of-the-art secret chamber to hide from intruders, she doesn't imagine she will ever need to use it - but then she hears from downstairs the chilling sound of breaking glass(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 163. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Jerrod Carmichael: 8
programme.desc: Comedian Jerrod Carmichael performs in New York City at Masonic Hall. Topics include Donald Trump's victory; climate change; supporting the troops; animal rights; being a good boyfriend; and his top four fears(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 4. Part 4 of 4. Dre produces Eminem's "The Slim Shady LP" that takes the rap music world by storm. Later, Dre and Jimmy create Beats Electronics and make a historic 2014 deal with Apple(n)

programme.title: Making of 'All Eyez on Me'
programme.desc: A look at "All Eyez on Me," a 2017 biopic of legendary rapper Tupac Shakur that chronicles his rise to fame and untimely death at the age of 25. The film stars Demetrius Shipp Jr., Danai Gurira and Lauren Cohan, and is directed by Benny Boom(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Alien-hunting agents hunt extraterrestrials bent on destroying Earth in this sequel(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Donna, an independent, single mother who owns a small hotel on an idyllic Greek island, is about to let go of Sophie, the spirited daughter she's raised alone. For Sophie's wedding, Donna has invited her two lifelong best girlfriends--practical and no-nonsense Rosie and wealthy, multi-divorcee Tonya--from her one-time backing band, Donna and the Dynamos. But Sophie has secretly invited three guests of her own(n)

programme.title: The Words That Built America
programme.desc: Documents written by the Founding Fathers—the Declaration of Independence, the U.S. Constitution and the Bill of Rights—are read by living presidents and vice presidents, members of Congress, diplomats, celebrities and middle-school students from the United Nations International School. David McCullough narrates(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: While Santa Claus rewards good children with gifts on Christmas, Krampus, a beast-like creature with demonic appearance, seeks out naughty children and punishes them(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Howard Payne is the taunting psycho threatening LA with high explosives, Jack Traven the agent who's close to catching him. When Payne loads a local bus with C4, Traven must evacuate the passengers while keeping the vehicle travelling at over 50mph. A breakneck recipe for thrills with a breakthrough role for Sandra Bullock(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: A professional thief takes his estranged daughter on the lam when a job goes awry. As crooks and corrupt cops close in on them, he also takes out a life-insurance policy on himself in an effort to leave something behind for his daughter(n)

programme.title: Crimson Tide
programme.desc: (1995) Undersea suspense drama following the power struggle between a commander and his executive officer on board a nuclear submarine which endangers the lives of the entire world. When they are put on alert after a volatile Russian nationalist seizes control of a nuclear missile base and the US stands at the brink of war, the by-the-book captain finds himself at odds with his second-in-command as the potentially catostrophic battle divides the crew.Dir: Tony Scott(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.sub-title: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change
programme.desc: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change. A look at the evolution of the firearms industry in the U.S. amid a fundamentally changed political landscape; a report on the potential economic blessing for Russia as world temperatures rise and Arctic sea ice melts(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: This thrilling adventure yarn finds an older and wiser Tarzan returning to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England. There, he clashes with a greedy Belgian captain who has sinister plans for his old home(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: This mockumentary satire of the music business and modern celebrity centers on self-absorbed pop rapper Conner4Real (Andy Samberg). Once a member of a popular rap trio called the Style Boyz, Conner is now a solo artist about to drop his second album. Unfortunately, the release gets abysmal reviews, and his career begins to melt down when his attempts at rehabing his image lead to such disasters as a global blackout and a proposal to his girlfriend interrupted by a wolf attack. Eventually, Conner considers burying the hatchet with former colleagues Owen (Jorma Taccone) and Lawrence (Akiva Schaffer) in order to reunite the Style Boyz. Tim Meadows, Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, and Imogen Poots co-star. Samberg, Taccone, and Schaffer co-wrote the screenplay, while Taccone and Schaffer shared directing duties(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 3. Part 3 of 4. Jimmy co-founds Interscope Records and cuts a deal with Death Row Records to become the label's distributor. But hostility mounts across America at the violence in rap music. Jimmy, Snoop Dogg and Tupac Shakur become embroiled in a violent feud with East Coast rap rivals, including Sean "Puffy" Combs and his Bad Boy Records(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: A cop in hi-tech "pre-crime" unit in 2054 goes on the run after being labeled as a future killer in this brilliant sci-fi action film. In order to prove his innocence, he kidnaps one of the psychics who predicts the imminent crimes while eluding a determined G-man(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Far from seeing eye to eye, Batman and Superman engage in a battle of the ages which plays straight into the hands into Lex Luthor. He unleashes Doomsday who is set to destroy Metropolis, unless Superman and Batman can put aside their differences and defeat the new nemesis with the help of Wonder Woman(n)

programme.title: Kicks
programme.desc: A black 15-year-old finally gets his hands on a coveted pair of Air Jordan sneakers, only to see them stolen by a local thug. With the help of two of his friends, he decides to embark on a thrilling adventure through inner-city Oakland to retrieve them(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Years after the events of The Bourne Ultimatum, former CIA assassin Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) resurfaces just as his former employers are implementing a new program aimed at hunting him down. Now fully recovered from his amnesia, Bourne teams up with Nicky Parsons (Julia Stiles) to uncover the truth behind his father's death, while simultaneously exacting revenge and evading the government forces hot on his trail. Paul Greengrass returns to helm this sequel, which co-stars Tommy Lee Jones, Alicia Vikander, Riz Ahmed, and Vincent Cassel(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Bridget worries about her relationship with Darcy and is upset when work reunites her with the womanising Daniel, in this sequel to "Bridget Jones's Diary"(n)

programme.title: Interview With the Vampire
programme.desc: Gothic horror story set in modern-day San Francisco about a two-hundred-year-old vampire who decides to reveal all about his existence to an increasingly beguiled tabloid journalist. Weary with wandering the world in search of fresh prey, the blood-sucking fiend takes time out to recall vignettes from a past life that embraces two centuries and four continents(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: A dangerous sniper traps a publicist in a public phone booth(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!
programme.desc: This outlandish comedy set in the golden age of showbiz centers on a slick Hollywood fixer named Eddie Mannix, who is pressed into action when a superstar actor is kidnapped and held for ransom. Mannix must race to quietly collect the ransom money before the gossip mags catch wind of the scandal(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: While Christmas shopping in New York for their respective partners, Jonathan and Sara meet by chance and fall in love before the day is over. At the end of the evening, Sara jumps in a cab and leaves, saying that if they are meant to be together, fate will find a way. Years later, as both are ready to marry different partners, destiny does indeed bring them back together and they rekindle their love(n)

programme.desc: U.K. General Election. The U.K. general election; and former FBI director James Comey's testimony before the Senate Intelligence Committee are discussed(n)

programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: On the eve of her sister's wedding, suburban teenager Samantha suffers silently as her family forgets her birthday. Even worse, some total dork keeps propositioning her with sophomoric innuendo when she really craves romantic attention from high-school hunk Jake. This bittersweet teen comedy traces the hopes and disappointments not only of Samantha, but also a host of incidental but memorable characters..(n)

programme.title: Beginner's Guide to Sex
programme.desc: An innocent virgin, Laci Cox is hired to teach a high school students sexual education(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Unshaven, chain-smoking archangel Michael is discovered in an elderly woman's home by a group of cynical tabloid reporters, who resolve to prove his existence to the world. Their cross-country journey becomes a quest for both redemption and love(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: The Lord of Darkness wants to retire but none of his three sons seems good enough for the job. When he decides he will not cede his throne to any of them, the two most powerful ones escape to Earth to create a kingdom for themselves. This action closes the portal filtering sinful souls to Hell and causes Satan to begin withering away. Now it's up to the weak but beloved Nicky to save his dad and the humankind before one of his brothers becomes the new Satan(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: Young Greek student Nia Vardalos causes uproar in her exuberant but traditional family when she brings home non-Greek new man John Corbett(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: Toula's family throws an even bigger Greek wedding for her parents, who learn they never officially tied the knot. Meanwhile, she tries to spice up her own marriage and deals with a daughter who's eager to escape from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: Tracey Ullman: Live & Exposed
programme.desc: The multitalented performer sings, dances and walks down memory lane in an autobiographical show that revisits some of her most famous alter egos, including makeup artist Ruby Romaine, veteran actress Linda Granger and Long Island housewife Fern Rosenthal. Taped in Los Angeles at the Henry Ford Theatre in February 2005(n)

programme.title: Airheads
programme.desc: Three rockers Chazz, Rex and Pip, try to get their demo played on a radio station, but when they are rudely turned down things quickly escalate!(n)

programme.title: The World According to Garp
programme.desc: The 1982 film version of the John Irving novel The World According to Garp attempts to captures the quirky spirit while condensing the Irving original. Robin Williams plays the title character, the son of unmarried, unorthodox feminist Jenny Fields (Glenn Close, in her film debut). Every effort made by Jenny to broaden Garp's outlook on life -- she even arranges for him to spend the night with a hooker (Swoosie Kurtz) -- crams more fears and phobias into his psyche. Aspiring to become a novelist, Garp succeeds in this goal at the same time that his mother publishes her first feminist manifesto. Though successful and happily married to college sweetheart Helen Holm (Mary Beth Hurt), Garp remains envious of his fearless mother, who has taken in the radical "Ellen Jamesians," a group named after a young woman who had her tongue cut out by a rapist. Mutilation, in fact, becomes something of a leitmotif in Garp's life, climaxing (in every sense of the word) in an auto accident brought about by Helen's tryst with Michael Milton (Mark Soper). There is, of course, much more to the story than this: standing out amongst the dozens of offbeat supporting characters is John Lithgow as Roberta Muldoon, a transexual ex-football jock. John Irving appears as a referee during a college wrestling match, while director George Roy Hill plays the pilot whose low-flying plane crashes into Garp's new home. The World According to Garp didn't attract as large an audience as other, more conventional Robin Williams vehicles, though Close and Lithgow would both be nominated for Best Supporting Actor statues(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: A madcap chase ensues when a crooked hotelier offers two million dollars to the first person who can find it(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: On Thursday nights three female friends -- Alex, Sukie, and Jane -- meet to chug martinis, learn Chinese aphrodisiac cooking and lament the scarcity of eligible men. As they sit around, they fantasize about and describe their idea of the ideal male. Arriving in town the following day is Satan, disguised as mysterious stranger Darrell Van Horn. One by one, Van Horne seduces each of the women. Then, strange things begin to happen(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2

programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip in this incredibly raunchy comedy(n)

programme.title: Do the Right Thing
programme.desc: A local black community is unhappy that their community is effectively being run by whites. As the heat rises on a hot summer's day in Brooklyn, so the racial tension, which has so far lay dormant under the surface, begins to rise(n)

programme.title: The Winning Season
programme.desc: In this touching comedy-drama, an alcoholic named Bill (Sam Rockwell) seeks redemption by coaching his daughter's high-school basketball team after his drinking problem squandered a career in the NBA. Directed by James C. Strouse(n)

programme.title: One Night Stand
programme.desc: Lew Schneider. Lew Schneider comments on New York City, appliances, marriage, parenthood and religion. Taped in Miami Beach(n)

programme.title: Off Air
programme.desc: Off Air(n)

programme.title: The Good Guy
programme.desc: This fun-loving romantic comedy follows a young New Yorker (Alexis Bledel) as she searches for the perfect man. A Wall Street big shot (Scott Porter) seems like the real deal, until she meets his handsome coworker (Bryan Greenberg) and comes to realize love is as big of a gamble as the stock market(n)

programme.desc: Unshaven, chain-smoking archangel Michael is discovered in an elderly woman's home by a group of cynical tabloid reporters, who resolve to prove his existence to the world. Their cross-country journey becomes a quest for both redemption and love(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: In this big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy flee to the French Riviera after an incident at a fashionable event causes them to be hounded by the paparazzi(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: In this comedy-drama based on true events, a down-on-his-luck massage therapist living in Miami (Miles Teller) teams up with a mercurial former classmate (Jonah Hill) to try to make it in the arms-dealing business. After starting small, the pals eventually get in over their heads when they land a 300-million-dollar contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry for forces in Afghanistan. Directed by Todd Phillips(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: A young Shakespeare, out of ideas and short of cash, meets his ideal woman and is inspired to write one of his most famous plays(n)

programme.title: One Night Stand
programme.desc: Gilbert Gottfried: Command Performance. Gilbert Gottfried harasses the audience; shares his theories on turtle care and on Elvis; imitates other comedians; and uses ripped napkins as props(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Semi-autobiographical tale from Spike Lee based on his childhood growing up in 70s New York. Young Troy watches her parents fight over money, and gets a chance to see how the other half lives when she visits wealthy cousins in the country(n)

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop

programme.title: Camp Nowhere
programme.desc: This light-hearted comedy depicts a typical summer camp, but with a special twist: this camp was designed by the campers themselves! "Mud" Himmel is a nerd. Once again he is faced with attending computer camp. His buddy Zack will be marching into go to military camp while Trish is acting happy about theater camp. That Gaby is going again to fat camp weighs heavily upon her mind. None of them are thrilled with their camp prospects and it is rebellious Mud who suggest that they create their own, secret camp. Enter Dennis Van Welker, their crazy high school drama instructor. He offers to join the conspiracy and act as their camp counselor. Just as it looks as if the four misfits are going to have a really great summer together, two dozen of their peers find out about the camp and decide to come along. For a time it's one big chaotic party. But as the kids act out their camp fantasies, they are gaining valuable insight into their lives(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: Eva Longoria Parker, Paul Rudd, and Lake Bell star in first-time feature filmmaker Jeff Lowell's heavenly romantic comedy concerning a female psychic and a doubtful skeptic who find their fledgling love affair thwarted by the latter's recently deceased fiancée. Henry (Rudd) and Kate (Longoria Parker) were all prepared to live out their "happily ever after" when tragedy struck from out of nowhere and Kate was killed on their wedding day. In the aftermath of the accident, a devastated Paul reluctantly takes his sister's advice and pays a visit to local psychic Ashley (Bell). Now, despite the fact that he openly questions her ability to communicate with the dearly departed, Paul can't help but fall head over heels in love with Ashley. Despite the fact that the feelings are most certainly mutual, however, their growing relationship is threatened when Kate makes it her supernatural mission to sabotage the happy couple's fledgling relationship before it starts to get serious(n)

Edward Douglas (David Thewlis) is on a UN mission when his aircraft crashes in the South Pacific. Taken to a remote island which is the domain of the mysterious Dr Moreau (Marlon Brando), Douglas encounters a race of strange, sub-human creatures who intrigue him. Douglas' curiosity draws him into restricted areas, where he is confronted with the full horror of Dr Moreau's genetic experiments on animals and humans. After the Dr's most frightening experiment goes badly wrong, Douglas realises that his own life may be in jeopardy unless he can somehow maintain order - as well as his own sanity(n)

Houston hires Costner when she starts receiving death threats from a stalker. The ex-presidential bodyguard has a past, however. He is wracked by guilt over his inability to protect Reagan from John Hinckley's assassination attempt. He's certainly not going to let a bullet slip past himagain and the draconian security measures he sets up are a shock to Houston. But Costner proves his worth when, in the face of death threats, the singer gives the performance of her life at the Oscar ceremony. Houston brings the house down with her performance of the Dolly Parton song 'I Will Always Love You'(n)

programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: An overnight shipment of drugs winds up being sent to the wrong recipient, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before the contents are discovered in this fast-paced crime comedy starring Donald Faison, Mos Def, and Mike Epps. When Brody (Epps) and Guch (Wood Harris) received package containing 10 kilos of grade-A cocaine, they assumed their financial woes were a thing of the past. The package was intended for their Brody and Guch's next-door neighbors, but the whacked-out courier (Donald Faison) delivered it to the wrong address. Recognizing the possibility for profit, the scheming duo plans to sell the cocaine to Brody's drug-dealing cousin (Omari Hardwick). Meanwhile Jesus (Cisco Reyes) and his girlfriend Chita (Yasmin Deliz), the intended recipients of the cocaine, set out to procure the package before notorious drug lord Bodego Diablo (Emilio Rivera) realizes it's gone missing. But Bodega is no slouch; he already knows the shipment was botched, and he's determined to get his drugs back no matter what the cost. Later, as Brody and Guch prepare to seal the deal that will set them up for life, the guns are drawn and the chaos begins(n)

J.K. Simmons, Jon Bernthal, Jeffrey Tambor, and John Lithgow co-star in this thriller directed by Gavin O'Connor (Warrior, Pride and Glory)(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, in his breakthrough role, stars as a straight-A student left in charge of the house by his holidaying parents. Grabbing the Porsche, he heads downtown and picks up glamorous hooker Rebecca De Mornay. She's on the run from her pimp and when she sees Cruise's house, she has an idea - seduce him and persuade him to turn it into a high class bordello for just one night, so she and her friends can relieve his friends of their cash. All goes well until her pimp turns up looking for payback in Paul Brickman's sex comedy that rises above the genre to be both entertaining and provoking(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: A superteam of vicious criminals including The Joker, Harley Quinn and Deadshot are recruited to embark on a suicide mission for the benefit of a government agency(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Christian Wolff (Ben Affleck) is a mathematical genius who works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations eager to hide their dirty money. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, Wolff agrees to help an accounting clerk at a robotics firm (Anna Kendrick) look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated. J.K. Simmons, Jon Bernthal, Jeffrey Tambor, and John Lithgow co-star in this thriller directed by Gavin O'Connor (Warrior, Pride and Glory)(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: A loner protecting a baby from hit men(n)

programme.title: Soul Food
programme.desc: For over 40 years, members of the Joseph family have gathered at Big Mama Joe's house to feast on soul food and familial love. Every Sunday, there was a mouth-watering array of fried chicken, catfish, cornbread, collards, potato salad, mac and cheese, biscuits, gravy, sweet potatoes and pie all lovingly prepared by Mama Joe (Irma P. Hall) and her three daughters, Teri, Maxine and Bird. These sisters could not be more different. Teri (Vanessa L. Williams) is an ambitious lawyer married to attorney/aspiring recording artist Miles (Michael Beach). As the wealthy ones in the otherwise middle-class clan, they are constantly helping out other family members, something that Teri resents, but always does. Bird (Nia Long) is the baby sister who at the beginning of the film marries Lem Davis (Mekhi Phifer), an ex-con struggling to stay straight. Bird has just opened a beauty shop thanks to a loan from Teri. Maxine (Viveca A. Fox) is a pregnant housewife happily married to hard-working Kenny (Jeffrey D. Sams). Their two children are cute little Kelly and 10-year-old Ahmad (Brandon Hammond), the story's narrator. He and Mama Joe share a special bond and he knows that she is the glue that keeps the family together. When Mama Joe falls ill, the glue weakens, old wounds between the sisters open, and familial chaos ensues, leaving only Ahmad to somehow obey his grandmother's wishes and reunite the family. Based on incidents from the life of screenwriter/director George Tillman, Soul Food is an upbeat comedy-drama, that while a little long, uneven in the middle and somewhat contrived in its attempts to manipulate the heartstrings, presents an African American family in a positive light. Its message could apply to any family: unity is strength(n)

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: (1976) Brian De Palma's classic horror film, based on Stephen King's novel, stars Sissy Spacek as the teenage Carrie, who is bullied at school and terrorised by her mother (Piper Laurie), and whose latent telekinetic powers find a terrifying outlet when she is humiliated and abused beyond endurance. With Amy Irving and William Katt. M,W,R,HD(n)

programme.title: Jennifer's Body
programme.desc: Student Jennifer Check is the stereotypical cheerleader: beautiful, bitchy and adored by all (other than those who are on the receiving end of her cruel wit) at her school in Devil's Kettle. However, local indie band Low Shoulder are more interested in her body than everyone else. In a bid to further their careers, they've made a pact with the Devil: one that requires the soul of a virgin. They kidnap and kill Jennifer, but unfortunately she was no virgin - and she rises again as a literal man-eater to take terrible retribution by ravenously rampaging her way through the school. Only one person stands a chance of halting the carnage: Jennifer's best friend Anita 'Needy' Lesnicky, who's nerdy, for sure, but also may have the strength of character to succeed where others have been ingested... And don't miss the excellent Australian horror The Loved Ones, up next(n)

programme.title: Cheech and Chong's Next Movie
programme.desc: In an unfunny, scattered sequel to their successful Up in Smoke, Cheech Marin and Tommy Chong reprise their roles as carefree men who do inhale. But this time around Cheech is out of a job and trying to dodge his bilious neighbor while chasing the lovely Donna (Evelyn Guerrero) with anything but honorable intentions. Meanwhile, Cheech's cousin Red (also Cheech Marin) and Chong go tooling around Hollywood in a luxury sports car looking for adventure(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is found strangled. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing. Former EastEnders actor Cliff Parisi (Minty) guest stars alongside Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Davina McCall: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: Davina travels to the Azores in the mid-Atlantic to investigate how animals cope with with atmospheric pressure changes underwater, particularly the ones that have to take in air before they submerge. She swims with a school of dolphins and finds out about the inbuilt response that both animals and humans have when they go underwater, and meets a world champion freediver who teaches her the techniques needed to swim alongside sperm whales, before trying to overcome her nerves and dive down to the ocean floor on a single breath.(n)

programme.title: Play to the Whistle

The seven-week series promises fun for all the family and some hilarious physical games alongside head-to-head quizzes and traditional panel show material, and with the show being filmed closed to transmission, there will also be plenty of topical elements. Comedian Seann Walsh acts as umpire throughout the series.(n)

The whole family are now tied to their home and desperately need an outdoor space on their doorstep that can become an escape.(n)

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's India
programme.desc: Joanna meets the Maharaja of Dungarpur who shows her around his lakeside palace, and a Dalit community in Gujarat, considered to be India's lowest caste. Braving the roads of Mumbai, Joanna takes a ride in the city's only all-female taxi company and visits the Times of India, where her uncle was editor of the paper in the 1930s and 40s. She then overcomes her fear of heights to explore the World One Tower, soon to be Mumbai's tallest luxury residential building.(n)

Cameras follow him as he helps look after eight elephant calves, including one year old Ultee. She has an injured foot, so Paul helps distract her while it gets treated. He also accompanies the elephant herd on their jungle walk, and sees how they're starting to adapt to their surroundings.(n)

programme.desc: Still reeling from the death of one of their own, Ronnie and Joe face a new challenge when an innocent young mum is fatally stabbed in a busy marketplace, just as a senior police officer publicly pledges to crack down on knife crime. Under pressure from all sides, the pair struggle to gather evidence against the youth they think is responsible, and the suspect's unintentional confession appears to bring the case to a close. However, Ronnie is the only person who hears the admission, and it proves difficult getting anyone to believe him. programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: Riggs' trauma regarding his wife's death returns at the worst possible time - just as he is beginning to embark on a relationship with Karen Palmer. He makes a shocking discovery about Miranda's demise that leads him back to the cartel in a frantic search for answers and his wild desperation leaves Murtaugh torn between his commitment to his partner and his devotion to his family. Damon Wayans, Clayne Crawford, Kevin Rahm, Floriana Lima and Johnathan Fernandez star in the final episode of this first series of the fast-moving detective drama, though a second run is already in the pipeline. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Sports Life Stories
programme.desc: A profile of the former boxer, a four-time world super-middleweight champion considered among the elite performers in his weight class. After rising through the domestic ranks and winning both the British and Commonwealth titles, Froch claimed his first world crown by defeating Jean Pascal in 2008, and was a dominant fighter on the world scene from that point on. His legacy was assured in May 2014 when he defeated fellow Brit George Groves in a rematch at Wembley Stadium in what proved to be his final fight. That contest drew the largest attendance for a boxing bout in the UK since the Second World War at 80,000. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert faces a traumatic first day back at work, and David confronts a difficult patient, but ends up fighting to save his own skin. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A murder gives rise to rumours of a communist conspiracy. Poirot becomes the centre of attention at the Chelsea Flower Show as he views a rose named in his honour, while Hastings receives a packet of seeds that give him hay fever. Whodunit, guest starring Anne Stallybrass (Heartbeat), with David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective is ordered to take a holiday for the benefit of his health, and with Hastings and Miss Lemon in tow, reluctantly heads for the tranquillity of Devon's coast, where his relaxation is soon ruined by the discovery of a socialite's murdered body on the beach. Several people had reason for wishing Arlena Stuart dead, but high on the list of suspects are her husband, teenage son and a troubled vicar. David Suchet, Hugh Fraser, Philip Jackson and Pauline Moran star.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of a man killed by a single gunshot wound is discovered on the moors and a burnt-out truck containing the remains of a deer is found a mile away. Joe is convinced the case is a poaching war gone wrong, but for Vera, the truth is never that straightforward. Delving into the victim's story, she unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist. Following the recent death of his grandfather, he returned to Northumberland after a 15-year absence to sell his inheritance to a wealthy couple - but pulled out of the deal at the last minute. Could his death be linked to a dispute over land? Brenda Blethyn and David Leon star in the murder mystery.(n)

programme.title: Brief Encounters
programme.desc: Believing her marriage is over, Steph starts life on her own, while Dawn decides she can no longer live at home and asks for refuge at Pauline's, much to Brian's annoyance. Nita makes a decision about her family's future. Drama, starring Penelope Wilton, Sophie Rundle, Angela Griffin and Sharon Rooney.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Jane Preston and Ben Shaw probe a case of assault in which a girl seems to have been attacked by a fellow member of her swimming team. However, when they discover the real reason why the victim is in hospital, their investigation turns toward the teenagers' families.(n)

programme.title: Mr Selfridge
programme.desc: Kitty is taken to hospital following the attack, and a horrified Frank later learns he may have been unwittingly complicit in the incident. As a police investigation begins, security is tightened at the store. Shaken by the evening's events, Harry abandons his theatre plans and takes Nancy to dinner instead. He toasts to friendship - but it becomes clear he's falling under her spell. A seductive Violette makes her move on Victor, who finds himself in trouble with DI Purkiss, while Henri and Agnes struggle to work through their problems.(n)

programme.title: Jekyll and Hyde
programme.desc: Part one of two. Robert is tormented by the recent tragedies that have befallen him, causing him to lose control of his transformations. Bulstrode reveals that military intelligence is holding Ravi prisoner, but will release him in return for Robert's help in investigating a series of strange killings. Robert takes on the case, and joins forces a vigilante also on the murderer's trail - but when the truth behind the slaughter emerges, it leads to his new ally becoming a dangerous threat that Bulstrode wants eliminated.(n)

programme.desc: Nick faces a dilemma after one of his colleagues is suspected of robbery and Greengrass develops a keen interest in a villager's greyhound. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.desc: The aftermath of the Titanic disaster causes conflict within the household, as Miss Forrest gradually assumes more responsibility - and no one is more incensed than Lady Bellamy's personal maid, who escaped the tragedy on a life-raft.(n)

programme.desc: Christine agrees to spend the day with Andrew, and Mike finally breaks his vow of silence, digging over a minefield of painful memories with Stella. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A young woman asks Poirot to investigate her father's murder - a 14-year-old crime for which her mother was found guilty and executed. The detective agrees to investigate, but warns his client that he may discover things she does not want to hear. David Suchet stars, with Rachael Stirling, Aidan Gillen, Aimee Mullens, Toby Stephens, Gemma Jones, Patrick Malahide and Annette Badland.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Trish returns to the scene of the crime in the hope it will prompt her to remember something more about the attack, while DC Katie Harford thinks she has a strong lead when she discovers a new suspect who doesn't have an alibi. Cath reveals interesting new information about the night of her party, while a match is made for the male DNA found on Trish. An unknown woman walks into the police station - and delivers some devastating new information when interviewed by Ellie and Hardy. Crime drama, starring David Tennant, Olivia Colman and Julie Hesmondhalgh.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the mysterious death of businessman John Shearwood, found floating in the water under the Gateshead Millennium Bridge when he was supposed to be on a golfing trip to Ireland. The man's wife Stella and brother Luke are baffled to discover he was working as an informant for HM Revenue and Customs. Chief Revenue investigator Owen Preece (guest star Robert Glenister) reveals John's business manager Mark Donovan has been running an alcohol scam through their haulage firm and the deceased had agreed to offer information in exchange for immunity from prosecution. Was his cover blown? Owen doesn't think so, and Mark has an alibi - unlike John's wife. Brenda Blethyn stars, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Max Mixson visits a house where more than 100 dogs are reportedly being confined in miserable conditions, but is given an angry reception by the owner.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Scott Wernick is unable to save the life of an emaciated horse, but later witnesses the birth of a calf.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of high-profile district attorney Ray Gricar, who went missing from his home area of Pennsylvania in April 2005. His laptop and hard drive were found destroyed in the Susquehanna River, leaving detectives wondering whether he had been murdered or gone on the run.(n)

programme.desc: The Sri Lankan billionaire arrested for insider trading as part of the largest ever-SEC case against a hedge fund. Plus, `The Wolf of Wall Street' who made millions running a penny stock scam that defrauded more than 1,500 clients.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: A revenge porn website that allowed explicit photos of people to be posted, without their permission and demands payment to remove them. Plus, El Chapo, who ran one of the world's largest drug trafficking organisations in the world.(n)

programme.desc: The story of Hollie Gazzard and Asher Maslin, who fell in love after meeting in a bar. However, Maslin was hiding his mental illness and when she ended the relationship, he decided no one else could have her.(n)

programme.desc: The case of Bill Douglas, a respected doctor at a Boston university. His focus was not on science, but on a prostitute and together, their double lives led to murder.(n)

programme.desc: Attempts by investigators to identify charred bones at a killer's dumping ground in Florida.(n)

programme.desc: The work of investigators and scientists at the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms who are dedicated to preventing terrorism and reducing violent crime.(n)

programme.desc: The murder of store manager Mary Peterson, who was found stabbed to death in her bed. A tip from an unlikely source helped identify her killer and school dropout-turned-robber James Woodham eventually pleaded guilty to the 1994 attack.(n)

programme.desc: The case of Californian teenagers Will Kleier, Jon Perez and Keyton Cornelius, who in July 2015 were apprehended while on a hunting trip and held hostage by Benjamin Ashley, a crazed transient brandishing a sawed-off shotgun.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old Raquel Rayas, who was found bleeding to death along Deep Creek Spillway in southern California. The incident left police with all kinds of questions and detectives turned to a mysterious phone number for help.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of mother and daughter Angela and Ashley Hyke who went missing in July 2001, leaving candles burning and electric fans running in their home. Days later their bodies were found in shallow graves. Authorities quickly recognised that the key to identifying the murderer might lie in Angela's diary.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of North Dakota student Dru Sjodin, who vanished in November 2003. CCTV footage showed Dru's last movements revealing the chilling reason for her disappearance.(n)

programme.title: Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: Retired homicide detective Chris Anderson and Los Angeles-based criminal defence attorney Melissa Lewkowicz revisit the case of lady's man, hustler and cult leader Freddie Freeman, suspected of the cold-blooded murder of a Michigan mayor.(n)

programme.title: The Real Story with Maria Elena Salinas
programme.desc: In 2009, police in New Mexico uncovered the remains of 11 women in the desert on the West Mesa of Albuquerque. An unprecedented investigation led to a serial killer on the loose.(n)

programme.desc: A devoted father who sought justice for the murder of his 15-year-old son, who was targeted, run over then robbed of his tablet computer.(n)

programme.desc: Danyall White recounts the true story of her brother Richard. Danyall always thought he was a prankster who told stories, but when his stories started getting more and more violent, she slowly realised he was hiding a monstrous secret.(n)

programme.desc: How murder investigation experts reconstruct crimes from the remains of burnt evidence when the body of the victim has yet to be identified.(n)

programme.desc: A case in which LAPD investigators hunted a criminal behind the disappearance of expensive yachts. As inquiries proceeded, they found a mild-mannered man among their own ranks who was involved in a lot more than just boat theft.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators in Wisconsin try to unravel the mystery of a house fire that may have been deliberately set to destroy evidence of a more heinous crime. Plus, in Florida an arsonist is linked to a series of fatal fires.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Gathering evidence from ashes and rubble to help forensics teams apprehend the perpetrators in cases of arson.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of mother-of-two Nikki Whitehead, who was killed in her own home. Police suspected she may have known her killer, resorting to polygraphs and CCTV footage to help reveal the horrific truth.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.desc: The case of 46-year-old Julie Williams, who died in April 1986 two days after drinking cyanide-laced water from an office cooler. Lewis Allen Harry, eventually convicted of her murder, had apparently been targeting his wife Sandra, who worked in the same establishment.(n)

programme.title: American Monster
programme.desc: The case of Max and Janeene Jones, who until his death appeared to have the perfect marriage. Suspicions were aroused about the nature of Max's demise, after Janeene was caught on camera trying to hire a hitman to kill her second husband, Matthew Smith, who she had a life insurance policy on.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The death of 19-year-old Kathy Bonney, who was shot at close range and her body dumped in Virginia's Great Dismal Swamp in 1987. Her father, Tom Bonney, claimed he feared she would grow up to live a corrupt life, so carried out the murderous act while possessed by an alternate personality named `Hitman'.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which a loving couple were gunned down and killed. A cryptic message found scrawled across the pair's bedroom wall led police to suspect the crime was drug related, though the victims had no obvious involvement in such an illegal trade.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old former cheerleader Amy Lord. CCTV footage from ATMs and outside her home captured the moment she was taken by her killer.(n)

programme.title: Murder Calls
programme.desc: The case of a priest stabbed to death and found by his parishioners. As part of their investigations, police discovered a harrowing emergency call made by the victim himself.(n)

programme.title: I Am Homicide
programme.desc: Detective Garry McFadden recalls being assigned to conduct what he thought will be a routine investigation of a man injured in a hit-and-run accident. After, the victim died, and McFadden discovered it had been a deliberate act.(n)

programme.desc: New series. The 1991 murder of New York fashion photographer Joel Schoenfeld, who was shot dead in his Greenwich Village studio. A dark secret and a tale of revenge emerged when it was claimed the Schoenfeld had raped the girlfriend of the man identified as the gunman.(n)

programme.title: The Good Nanny
programme.desc: A young woman begins a job as a nanny for a peculiar girl, but she soon suspects something is very wrong with the beautiful, wealthy couple that call themselves her parents(n)

programme.title: Gone
programme.desc: A haunted woman wages a valiant fight to rescue her daughter from a gang of kidnappers in this Lifetime Original Movie starring Molly Parker (Deadwood, The Road). The victim of a brutal assault that destroyed her marriage and threatened her future as a mother, Amy is devastated when her young daughter, Emily, is suddenly and mysteriously abducted. But when the kidnappers attempt to manipulate Amy into killing a patient in the hospital where she works in exchange for her daughter's safe return, the desperate mother boldly refuses. Now, as Amy searches desperately for clues to Emily's whereabouts, she gradually discovers that the malevolent plot leads directly to the most powerful people in her city. With the police and local politicians doing everything in their power to destroy her family, Amy must avoid succumbing to the emotional pain of her past trauma, and find her daughter so the conspiracy will be exposed and justice served(n)

programme.desc: House-hunters Jonathan Joyce and Julia Hobson search for a holiday home in Costa Almeria, Spain. They require a place with good rental potential and sea views on a budget of around £150,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Old Stables, Somerset, where Finnish-born Nina Dodd and her husband Andy welcome guests to their Scandinavian-style accommodation. While some are impressed by the immaculate interior, David and Erica Hensley are not pleased about the no-shoes policy.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Rigsby's Guest House in Hertfordshire, where owner Morris Cockman entertains his rivals with a visit to a local zoo. Not all of his guests are impressed, and a slow breakfast service does not improve his chances of success.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: David and Erica Hensley host at the Fairway in Blackpool, where they hope to win over their guests with a spot of classic seaside entertainment. After taking their fellow contestants on a horror walk, the couple will be wary of any unexpected surprises when it comes to their scores.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Robin Hughes is the final host of the week in the converted Dent Station in the Yorkshire Dales. He organises a butchery competition and high-end food, before some home truths about the group dynamic are revealed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners meet one last time to discover how much their rivals thought they should receive and to settle some scores. Robin Hughes' remarks from across the week are discussed, before the winner of the competition is revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman comes to the aid of Ruth Jobey, who wants to leave her busy London life behind and work as a virtual PA from the relaxed town of Olivia on Spain's Costa Azahar.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman helps good friends Mike Dawson and Louise Clark search for a holiday apartment in the resort of Sitges, near Barcelona, on a budget of £170,000. Louise is hoping for somewhere to escape with her two-year-old daughter, while Mike is looking to make the first step in a potentially permanent move.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team take part in a dig at the site of three historic jails buried under a police station car park in the old market town of Appleby, Cumbria. While hunting for the cells, the archaeologists find evidence of a renowned 18th-century escape and the infamous hanging room.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: The Forgotten Gunners of WW1: A Time Team Special.
programme.desc: The team visits Belton House stately home near Grantham, Lincolnshire, to investigate the creation of the Machine Gun Corps during the First World War. The regiment was set up in the grounds, but today there is virtually no sign of its existence and most regimental records have been destroyed. The dig, however, is rich in finds, revealing glimpses of the lives of the thousands of men who trained at the site, many of whom died in battle.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and mechanic Fuzz Townshend go to Leeds to repair an AC Aceca, a British sports car that has been kept and loved by its owner Monet since the early 1970s.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and his team's first patient is a West Highland terrier puppy that has a problem with its paws. Two new bionic feet later, and the poorly dog has a new lease of life. A young husky collie is also brought in after being hit by a car, only for the hip replacement operation to run into trouble, and a lazy dachshund requires double surgery and lots of physiotherapy.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Pioneering veterinary surgeon Noel Fitzpatrick gets to work on more animals in need of his help. A puppy is rushed into the surgery after being hit by a car, leading to a series of operations including a skin graft in which the dog's leg is sewn into her stomach. A Great Dane requires high-risk surgery after being diagnosed with a cancerous tumour in its leg, and a Chihuahua has shattered the bones in its paw falling down the stairs while chasing a cat. Can the professor help?.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows interior designer Kathryn Tyler as she tries to create a Scandinavian-style eco house in her mother's back garden in Falmouth, Cornwall, close by the Lizard Peninsula. The plan is ambitious, featuring a white-painted brick ground floor, a lightweight timber-frame first floor and cleverly designed spaces, but the small size of the plot and Kathryn's inexperience could hamper the project.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: Craft mason and mountain rescuer Pete Roe is called out to try and find a puppy that has fallen down a 50-foot sinkhole near Wensleydale.(n)

programme.title: Would You Take in a Stranger
programme.desc: Following three young people in very different circumstances who have come to Nightstop, a national emergency accommodation service, in need of somewhere to stay.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of a French restaurant in the heart of Moorpark, California. The pompous, over-complicated cuisine is keeping the customers away and there is an imminent threat of bankruptcy. However, the owner is vigorously opposed to change, despite the failings of his current business model.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: Craft mason and mountain rescuer Pete Roe is called out to try and find a puppy that has fallen down a 50-foot sinkhole near Wensleydale.(n)

programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, as Jon Richardson and David O'Doherty take on guest captain Johnny Vegas and Jamie Laing. Holly Walsh joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by guests Mel Giedroyc, Johnny Vegas, Kym Marsh and Aisling Bea to discuss and dissect the events that set the British public's chins wagging over the past week. Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman comes to the aid of Ruth Jobey, who wants to leave her busy London life behind and work as a virtual PA from the relaxed town of Olivia on Spain's Costa Azahar.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Black Lion in Halland, East Sussex, where host Nigel Fright gets off to a shaky start when a kettle goes missing from one of the rooms. Later, he takes the guests to a salsa class, where Sherrill Tacy and Hayley Cotton are surprised by some of his dance moves.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to the Wheatsheaf Inn in Exning, near Newmarket, Suffolk, where guests are welcomed by owner Ken Clutterbuck and employee Ginny Trow. The proprietor tries to win his rivals round with his unique sense of humour, but tensions rise when the contestants go for a spin on a go-kart track.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sherrill Tacy hosts at the Sherwood Guest House in New Brighton on the Wirral, and is praised for the establishment's value for money. However, there is upset when her breakfast leaves a lot to be desired, and her final review is far from perfect.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Final hosts Mark and Rachael Dann welcome the contestants to the Big Bear Lodge in Shropshire. They face the tough job of trying to keep the rift between some of the guests to a minimum in their ski-themed B&B, and their afternoon activity of canoeing raises a few laughs but accusations of cheating occur when the boys begin to get competitive.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service that they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Pia and Stephen Abbott have been married for 35 years and have long dreamt of owning a property in Spain. Jasmine Harman helps the couple find a home around La Marina Alta within their £130,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Elsa and Brian Surridge, who are looking for a retirement home on the Costa Blanca and have a cash budget of £75,000 to spend.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team explore a site at Brancaster in Norfolk that is believed to have been a Roman `shore fort', and possibly a key military outpost. They amass 2,500 finds - their biggest-ever haul - which provide information on contemporary decorative arts, sport and much more, and also undertake a high-definition geophysics survey that generates enough data to crash the computers. The biggest surprise reveals evidence of a high level of trade with the local population, and clues as to how Britons living near the site benefited financially from the Roman presence.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and a team of specialist historians help Hektor Rous, the son of `Aussie Earl' Keith Rous, piece together the mysterious history of the family's Tudor country home in Suffolk. In 2004, he moved from Melbourne, Australia, hoping to rebuild the estate's fortunes, and established events such as the Latitude Festival in its 3,500-acre grounds.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to West Sussex to rescue an iconic 1970s motor - and the first truly successful Japanese car export - the mighty Datsun 240z.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and his team fight to save the leg of a much-loved golden retriever, and a French bulldog with twisted elbows needs a doggy wheelchair and some challenging surgery. At Noel's Oncology & Soft Tissue Hospital in Guildford, a spaniel cross has a tumour removed by specialist Professor Nick Bacon.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel and his team face an emergency when a black Labrador is rushed in after being hit by a car. The pioneering vets also treat a cocker spaniel with a bulging disc in its spine and a basset hound that needs its leg straightening. But the dog is also overweight, so the professor insists it be put on a diet.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Tim and Philomena O'Donovan, who are trying to convert the old lifeboat station in Tenby, Pembrokeshire, into a contemporary home and preserve the historic building for posterity. A weather-worn, rusting and rotting hulk that was never designed for habitation, it is perched on a steel pier 40ft above the sea and can only be reached by crossing the sandy beach at low tide.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Peter Maddison meets Nick and Nicole New from Queensland, who have given an architect the job of creating a house that is sympathetic to the dense rainforest surrounding their land.(n)

programme.title: The Billion Pound Hotel
programme.desc: Shaped like a giant sail and standing more than 1,000ft tall, the Burj Al Arab in Dubai cost an estimated £1billion to build, and has been dubbed the world's most luxurious hotel. Guests paying anything up to £10,000 a night expect only the highest of standards, so what does it take for the staff to satisfy these demanding customers? This programme follows the stories of a variety of visitors, from the King of Uganda to a firefighter who has saved up months of wages, and the workers who serve them.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways.
