programme.desc: The crimes of serial killer Trevor Hardy - the so-called `Beast of Manchester' - who murdered three teenage girls in the mid-1970s. Despite being arrested after the second killing, Hardy was freed on the basis of an alibi he had arranged with his then-partner.(n)

programme.title: Harold Shipman
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary analysing the crimes of serial killer Harold Shipman, the doctor believed to be responsible for the deaths of an estimated 250 people. The first instalment of this two-part programme looks at what drove Shipman to kill over a period of almost 30 years, examining his early school days as a model pupil up to his time as a junior doctor in Pontefract Hospital. Featuring interviews with Margaret Sivorn, who worked with him in Pontefract, and consultant forensic psychiatrist Richard Badcock, who was the only psychiatrist to assess Shipman.(n)

programme.title: Harold Shipman
programme.desc: The concluding edition of this two-part docu-drama looks at how Shipman covered his tracks and examines the unravelling of decades of lies that subsequently led to his conviction. In March 1998, staff at the local crematorium became suspicious of the deaths signed off by Shipman and alerted the coroner, but a police investigation was stopped after just three weeks. It was the subsequent death of Kathleen Grundy that triggered his downfall, and her daughter and son-in-law Angela and Phil Woodruff describe their reactions when they discovered that Shipman was bizarrely the sole benefactor of Kathleen's estate.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: Richard E Grant travels to Venice, said to be the city with the highest concentration of luxury hotels on the planet. He discovers how a measuring error led to the building of the city's biggest swimming pool, tries out a 15,000 euro-a-night royal suite whose bed has been slept in by everyone from the Beckhams to Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall, and visits a hotel that keeps its doors open even when water floods to knee height. He also finds out why breaking a window once earned Ernest Hemingway a 10 per cent discount on his room.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming examines the hidden histories of cities, revealing the sights and sounds rarely witnessed by the public. He begins in London at St Paul's Cathedral, where he visits a place tourists never go, before exploring a hidden park and a little-known church. He also gets a guided tour of Soho from broadcaster Danny Baker.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Amy Gardner's lobbying for domestic violence prevention provokes President Bartlet's fury, Will Bailey is pleased to receive an offer to become Vice President Russell's top aide, and a conservative Democrat senator switches parties, a move which causes tension in the corridors of power.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: As President Bartlet is preoccupied with a tornado in Oklahoma, a worried Leo grapples with several crises back home that require immediate attention. Josh fears the worst after a political miscalculation costs the Democrats dearly, making him Washington's latest persona non grata.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The team searches for a woman who disappeared mysteriously from her fiance's dinner party, while Samantha sees a therapist to help her deal with problems at work.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Catherine and Grissom investigate the death of a casino worker and the case of a tourist who has been badly beaten, and soon realise both attacks are linked to a violent mob. Meanwhile, Greg intervenes in one of the gang's assaults - but his actions have unforeseen consequences. Forensic drama, guest starring Kevin Federline.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez team up with two visiting operatives to search for a dangerous Russian fugitive who entered the US on a diplomatic visa.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Fish merchant Robert and his wife Kelly decide to open a seafood restaurant in Brixham - but their determinedly contemporary approach to cuisine leaves some locals unimpressed. The programme also follows the journey of a turbot over 36 hours, as it is caught and auctioned off before being served in an exclusive London restaurant.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: As Chief Justice Ashland's health problems mount, his former clerk Joe Quincy is pressed into service to persuade him to retire. CJ prepares Zoey for a briefing about her kidnapping, Abbey reveals an uncomfortable truth about her marriage, and President Bartlet refuses to be bullied by the Republicans over budget negotiations. Matthew Perry guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet and the powerful Republican Speaker of the House disagree over the budget, leading to a crisis when the federal government is shut down. Leo, Josh and Toby send White House staff home, but the trio are uneasy as the President refuses to compromise - until Josh hatches a bold plan to challenge the opposing party. Meanwhile, Abbey reappears from her self-imposed exile for a state dinner that she might have to cook herself. Gary Cole guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: A 14-year-old musical prodigy disappears on the night of a concert, taking her valuable violin with her. Meanwhile, Samantha tries to recover from her gunshot wound, but makes slow progress. Anthony LaPaglia stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Nuns are horrified to find a woman crucified in a church, and subsequent investigations suggest she was sleeping with the popular new parish priest - leading Grissom to suspect their forbidden affair could have led him to kill her. Forensic drama, starring William Petersen, Jorja Fox and Marg Helgenberger.(n)

programme.title: Public Enemy
programme.desc: In the season finale, Chloe is granted a reprieve and retraces the final elements of the case, and she has to try and reach the killer in time. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The development of London during the Victorian era, as the city at the heart of the British empire rapidly expanded - and social divisions became increasingly pronounced. The programme explores the grandeur of the period, including the building of the Crystal Palace, as well as sharp rises in vice and crime that prompted outrage among reformers including Charles Dickens and Josephine Butler. There is also a look at how football became increasingly popular.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming tours the less-celebrated sights of Brighton, beginning by visiting the Toy and Model Museum to look at its collection of model trains. He then discovers a boutique that sells a variety of unusual items, before taking a glimpse behind the scenes at the Royal Pavilion.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming explores the history of Bristol, beginning by learning a grisly secret at the docks before meeting Mercury Prize-winning musician Roni Size to discuss life in the St Pauls and Stokes Croft areas of the city. He also explores the district of Clifton and visits a speakeasy-style bar.(n)

programme.desc: The cameras follow three teams of fishermen participating in Brixham's annual Trawler Race, including a father and son who have been pitted against each other. Landlady Pat Seddon is not looking forward to the raucous celebrations, however, and decides to reminisce about past race days instead. The programme also meets Matt Kimble, a graduate who gave up on his plan to become a PE teacher and decided to follow his ancestors into the fishing trade instead.(n)

programme.desc: President Bartlet's Christmas preparations at the White House are overshadowed by the news that aid workers have been kidnapped in the Sudan. programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet attends the funeral of a former president, along with two of his predecessors. The flight out offers them the chance to chew over their mistakes, and ponder their impact on the current crises facing the nation. Leo learns his ex-wife is to remarry, CJ investigates disturbing scientific experiments and Josh gets caught in the middle of a heated debate. John Goodman and James Cromwell guest star.(n)

programme.title: The Pink Panther Strikes Again
programme.desc: Inspector Clouseau fends off a murder syndicate led by his former police chief Dreyfus, who has been driven insane by his hatred for the bungling detective. However, doing away with the lucky lawman proves harder than anticipated - even for the world's best assassins. Comedy sequel, starring Peter Sellers, Herbert Lom, Lesley-Anne Down, Burt Kwouk and Leonard Rossiter.(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: A romantic novelist goes in search of her kidnapped sister in the steamy jungles of South America, only to become the target of a villainous general who demands as a ransom the valuable treasure map in her possession. Help is at hand in the form of a craggy daredevil fortune hunter, who has his eye on a share of the profits. Comedy adventure, starring Michael Douglas, Kathleen Turner and Danny DeVito.(n)

programme.title: Valentine's Day
programme.desc: Anthology of stories charting the romantic complications of various Los Angeles residents. A businessman and a soldier on leave share a flight home, a teacher is smitten with a doctor and an elderly couple comfort their lovesick grandson. Romantic comedy drama, with Ashton Kutcher, Jessica Alba, Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Laws of Attraction
programme.desc: Two feuding New York lawyers head for Ireland to represent a rock star and his wife in their divorce proceedings. But after a drink-fuelled knees-up, the baffled attorneys wake to find they have accidentally married each other. Romantic comedy, starring Pierce Brosnan, Julianne Moore, Parker Posey, Michael Sheen and Frances Fisher.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine
programme.desc: A man suffering a midlife crisis tries to recapture his lost youth by going back to his old haunts with two equally unhappy friends and his teenage nephew. They end up being transported back to 1986 and are tempted to give themselves the lives they always wanted - despite warnings that they must not change anything. Sci-fi comedy, starring John Cusack, Clark Duke, Craig Robinson and Rob Corddry.(n)

programme.title: Dope
programme.desc: A geeky teenager in an inner-city neighbourhood harbours dreams of going to Harvard. He and his friends think their social standing at school is set to improve when they get an invitation to an underground party, but the night leaves them mixed up in crime and drugs and forced to grow up fast. Crime comedy, starring Shameik Moore and Tony Revolori.(n)

programme.title: Big Daddy
programme.desc: An immature 32-year-old is heartbroken when his girlfriend walks out on him. In a plan to win her back, he volunteers to look after his flatmate's five-year-old son, thus demonstrating he is finally ready to grow up. However, his ideas of childcare prove unconventional and chaos quickly ensues. Comedy, with Adam Sandler, Joey Lauren Adams, Jon Stewart, Josh Mostel, Leslie Mann, Rob Schneider and Kristy Swanson, alongside Steve Buscemi in a cameo role.(n)

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee
programme.desc: A New York reporter searches the Australian Outback for a maverick hunter with a legendary reputation, and invites the adventurer back to America. But the die-hard Aussie needs to draw on all his survival skills to adjust to life in the urban jungle. Comedy adventure, written by and starring Paul Hogan, with Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Mark Blum.(n)

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine
programme.desc: A man suffering a midlife crisis tries to recapture his lost youth by going back to his old haunts with two equally unhappy friends and his teenage nephew. They end up being transported back to 1986 and are tempted to give themselves the lives they always wanted - despite warnings that they must not change anything. Sci-fi comedy, starring John Cusack, Clark Duke, Craig Robinson and Rob Corddry.(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A retiree grows tired of the quiet life and becomes an intern at a start-up run by a beautiful entrepreneur, and teaches the young staff a few things about successful business. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Anne Hathaway and Rene Russo.(n)

programme.title: Police Academy
programme.desc: An American police college lowers its entrance requirements in the hope of attracting new recruits, and in response, assorted dubious candidates turn up for enrolment. A short-tempered instructor is determined to weed out the bad apples, but a riot provides the clueless cops with a chance to prove their worth. Comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Kim Cattrall, Bubba Smith and GW Bailey.(n)

programme.title: Mistress America
programme.desc: A lonely student finds her first year at university in New York a disappointing experience, with uninspiring studies and no social life. Everything changes when her mother remarries and she acquires a new stepsister, whose bizarre schemes draw her into the kind of lifestyle she had always dreamed of - and provide fresh creative inspiration. Comedy, starring Lola Kirke and Greta Gerwig.(n)

programme.title: Jackass: The Movie
programme.desc: Johnny Knoxville and his gang of daredevil friends bring the MTV series to the big screen. As usual, they perform a variety of weird and wonderful stunts, including crawling across dozens of mousetraps while wearing rodent make-up, and being rolled down bowling lanes on skateboards. Comedy, with Bam Margera, Henry Rollins, Spike Jonze and Tony Hawk.(n)

programme.title: Son of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Comedy sequel which sees Inspector Clouseau's over-enthusiastic son on the trail of a kidnapped princess, proving to be just as inept as his father every step of the way. Starring Roberto Benigni, Herbert Lom, Claudia Cardinale, Burt Kwouk, Debrah Farentino and Graham Stark.(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming: Special
programme.desc: The making of the new Marvel superhero movie, which sees Tom Holland as the friendly neighbourhood Spider-Man, taking on Michael Keaton's Vulture with the help of Iron Man.(n)

programme.title: Drillbit Taylor
programme.desc: Three kids fall foul of the local bully on their first day at high school, so they advertise for a bodyguard. They end up hiring a man who turns out to be a low-rent mercenary, but discover their new-found protector is not quite the hardened soldier of fortune he claims to be. Comedy, starring Owen Wilson, Leslie Mann, Nate Hartley and Troy Gentile.(n)

programme.title: Date and Switch
programme.desc: Premiere. Two guys make a pact to lose their virginity before their senior prom, but things take an unexpected turn when one of them comes out of the closet. Comedy, starring Nicholas Braun, Hunter Cope and Dakota Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Meatballs
programme.desc: A summer camp leader's trainee staff drive him up the wall with their endless mischief-making, prompting him to knock them all into shape for an imminent sporting contest. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Harvey Atkin, Kate Lynch and Russ Banham.(n)

programme.title: Sausage Party
programme.desc: When he hears life after the supermarket isn't much fun for groceries, Frank the sausage investigates. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth Rogen and Kristen Wiig.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: A feminist FBI agent is sent undercover as a contestant in the Miss United States pageant when the event becomes the target of a terrorist bomb threat. As she is not exactly catwalk material, a veteran British coach is brought on board to oversee her transformation into a glamorous beauty queen. Comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen and William Shatner.(n)

programme.title: Working Girl
programme.desc: Naive but ambitious secretary Tess discovers her conniving boss has been claiming credit for her ideas. She hatches a plan to get revenge and further her own career into the bargain, with a little help from the unscrupulous executive's boyfriend. Comedy, starring Melanie Griffith, Sigourney Weaver, Harrison Ford, Joan Cusack and Alec Baldwin.(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A journalist lives her life by her father's maxim that monogamy never works, and has spent her adult life enjoying freedom from commitment. When she is sent to interview a doctor, an attraction develops between them, and she begins to wonder if there mighty be something to be said for a stable relationship. Comedy, starring Amy Schumer, Bill Hader, Brie Larson and Tilda Swinton.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: A feminist FBI agent is sent undercover as a contestant in the Miss United States pageant when the event becomes the target of a terrorist bomb threat. As she is not exactly catwalk material, a veteran British coach is brought on board to oversee her transformation into a glamorous beauty queen. Comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen and William Shatner.(n)

programme.title: Sausage Party
programme.desc: When he hears life after the supermarket isn't much fun for groceries, Frank the sausage investigates. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth Rogen and Kristen Wiig.(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Me
programme.desc: A mentally unstable woman whose life revolves entirely around daytime TV wins the lottery. She immediately stops taking her medication and pays a television studio millions to let her broadcast a show sharing her outlandish views and troubled past with the world. Comedy, Kristen Kirsten Wiig and Tim Robbins.(n)

programme.title: A Goofy Movie
programme.desc: The Disney cartoon dog takes his son on an old-fashioned fishing trip in an attempt to bond with the lad. However, young Max has boasted to his pals that he is going to a pop concert in Los Angeles, and has a few ideas on how to trick his dopey dad. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Bill Farmer, Jason Marsden and Wallace Shawn.(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan.(n)

programme.title: Brave
programme.desc: A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Aladdin
programme.desc: A street urchin is caught up in a scheming grand vizier's plot to get his clutches on a magical lamp. Retrieving the object from a wondrous cave, he releases a powerful genie trapped inside, whose ability to grant wishes helps the young hero thwart the villain's plans and woo a princess. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger and Linda Larkin.(n)

programme.title: Eight Below
programme.desc: An Antarctic scientific expedition has to be aborted when a blizzard hits, forcing their guide to leave behind his team of huskies in the frozen wilderness. He is determined to return and rescue the animals, but in the meantime, the dogs have to rely on pack instinct alone to ensure their survival in the hostile climate. Disney adventure, starring Paul Walker, Bruce Greenwood and Jason Biggs.(n)

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass
programme.desc: Alice returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska and Johnny Depp.(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan.(n)

programme.title: Monsters, Inc
programme.desc: Two monsters work for an energy firm that employs scary creatures to sneak into children's bedrooms and convert their screams into power. However, when a little girl accidentally wanders into the pair's domain, they have to race against time to return her safely home before anyone finds out. Pixar animated comedy, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Steve Buscemi and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass
programme.desc: Alice returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska and Johnny Depp.(n)

programme.title: Brave
programme.desc: A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
programme.desc: A Victorian scientist investigating the mysterious sinking of whaling ships in the Pacific falls overboard during an attack on his vessel. Along with a veteran mariner and a diver, he is picked up and taken captive by Captain Nemo and whisked away on a series of adventures in his futuristic submarine. Disney fantasy, based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Kirk Douglas, James Mason, Paul Lukas and Peter Lorre.(n)

programme.title: The Watcher in the Woods
programme.desc: Two sisters are haunted by a ghost when they and their American family move into an old mansion set deep in an English forest. As the spirit makes more and more contact with them, the girls come to realise that the spirit is the ghost of the owner's child who went missing long ago. Thriller, starring Bette Davis, Carroll Baker, David McCallum and Lynn-Holly Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Now You See Him, Now You Don't
programme.desc: A science student creates an invisibility spray, an invention that could help save his college from financial ruin - but it soon attracts the attention of a gang of scheming crooks wanting to use it for more dishonest ends. Disney adventure, sequel to The Computer Wore Tennis Shoes, starring Kurt Russell, Cesar Romero, Joe Flynn and Jim Backus.(n)

programme.title: Benji the Hunted
programme.desc: Talented mongrel Benji is separated from his trainer in a shipwreck and ends up stranded in the Canadian wilderness - where he becomes foster father to a litter of orphaned cougar cubs. However, a hungry timber wolf is also prowling in the area, and looks set to clash with the courageous dog. Disney adventure, starring Red Steagall, Frank Inn and Nancy Francis.(n)

programme.title: The Gnome-Mobile
programme.desc: An eccentric millionaire, along with his niece and nephew, finds two gnomes whose homes have been destroyed. They decide to help them find the rest of the tribe, but the family's friends think the tiny creatures are a figment of their imagination. Children's fantasy, starring Walter Brennan, Matthew Garber and Karen Dotrice.(n)

programme.title: Aladdin and the King of Thieves
programme.desc: The Arabian adventurer prepares to marry his beloved Jasmine, but gets distracted by a gang of robbers who have stolen a powerful magical artefact, as well as the news that his long-lost father is still alive. Animated adventure sequel, with the voice of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger, Linda Larkin and John Rhys-Davies.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
programme.desc: A single-minded American golfer's determination helps him to overcome the sport's class prejudice against his working-class background and his father's cynicism for the chance to test his skills against his idol in the 1913 US Open. Fact-based drama directed by Bill Paxton, starring Shia LaBeouf, Stephen Dillane, Elias Koteas and Josh Flitter.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A bookish woman agrees to take her father's place as prisoner of a fearsome monster living in a castle deep in the forest. She gradually grows to see a gentler, more human side to her hideous host, and comes to realise she may be able to break the curse that turned him into a beast in the first place. Disney animated fantasy, with the voices of Paige O'Hara and Robby Benson.(n)

programme.title: Sanjay's Super Team
programme.desc: Bored with his father's meditation, a young Indian boy daydreams of Hindu gods as superheroes. Animated short, with the voices of Brent Schraff, Sunny Singh Attar, Arun Rao and Jaquelynn Herrera.(n)

programme.title: Tarzan
programme.desc: A man raised by gorillas in the jungle has his first encounter with humans in the form of a scientist and his daughter, and is torn between remaining among the apes or rediscovering his roots. He must also fight to defend his animal friends from a big-game hunter. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Tony Goldwyn and Minnie Driver.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A bookish woman agrees to take her father's place as prisoner of a fearsome monster living in a castle deep in the forest. She gradually grows to see a gentler, more human side to her hideous host, and comes to realise she may be able to break the curse that turned him into a beast in the first place. Disney animated fantasy, with the voices of Paige O'Hara and Robby Benson.(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
programme.desc: A single-minded American golfer's determination helps him to overcome the sport's class prejudice against his working-class background and his father's cynicism for the chance to test his skills against his idol in the 1913 US Open. Fact-based drama directed by Bill Paxton, starring Shia LaBeouf, Stephen Dillane, Elias Koteas and Josh Flitter.(n)

programme.title: Invincible
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck barman is having a hard time coping after his wife leaves him and he loses his teaching job. His fortunes turn around when the American football team he has supported all his life holds open trials and, against all odds, he wins a place on the squad. Fact-based sporting drama, starring Mark Wahlberg, Greg Kinnear and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: Rocky IV
programme.desc: The Italian Stallion agrees to help former champion Apollo Creed train for a match against a seemingly invincible boxer from the Soviet Union, only to see his friend die as a result of injuries sustained in the fight. Rocky vows to avenge him, and prepares to take on the Russian heavyweight in his own country. Drama sequel, directed by and starring Sylvester Stallone. With Dolph Lundgren, Talia Shire, Carl Weathers and Brigitte Nielsen.(n)

programme.title: Mean Machine
programme.desc: A disgraced soccer star jailed for assaulting two policemen is persuaded by the prison authorities to form a football team of inmates to take on the guards. Unfortunately, whipping his fellow prisoners into shape proves a tricky proposition. Comedy drama, starring Vinnie Jones, Jason Statham, David Hemmings and Jason Flemyng.(n)

programme.title: Domino
programme.desc: The daughter of a respected actor becomes bored with her high society lifestyle and trains to become a bounty hunter. However, the thrills of her new occupation, coupled with the presence of television cameras recording her exploits for a reality TV show, soon send her life spiralling out of control. Thriller, starring Keira Knightley, Mickey Rourke and Jacqueline Bisset.(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
programme.desc: The swashbuckling rogues join forces with old foe Barbossa to take on villainous Lord Beckett. But first they have to journey to the ends of the Earth to free Captain Jack Sparrow from his hellish imprisonment in Davy Jones' Locker. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Johnny Depp, Geoffrey Rush, Orlando Bloom, Keira Knightley and Chow Yun-Fat, and featuring a cameo appearance by Keith Richards.(n)

programme.title: The Matrix Revolutions
programme.desc: As the survivors of the human race make their last stand against the machines, freedom fighters Neo and Trinity undertake a desperate journey into the heart of the enemy stronghold seeking a way to end the war, while the rogue computer programme Smith sets about remaking the virtual world of the Matrix in his own image. Conclusion of the sci-fi trilogy, starring Keanu Reeves, Carrie-Anne Moss, Laurence Fishburne and Hugo Weaving.(n)

programme.title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine
programme.desc: Years before he joins the superhero team, mutant Logan is a member of a top secret military unit, but quits because he cannot justify his squad's brutal methods. However, when the woman he loves is murdered by his psychotic brother, Logan returns to his old enemies for help in seeking revenge - and is offered the chance to become indestructible. Superhero adventure prequel, starring Hugh Jackman and Liev Schreiber.(n)

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: Nasa discovers an asteroid the size of Texas is on a collision course with Earth, so a drilling expert is recruited to train a team of misfits to transport a nuclear device into outer space to destroy it - but having had no experience of space travel, the reluctant astronauts find themselves seriously out of their depth. Sci-fi thriller, with Bruce Willis, Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, Michael Clarke Duncan, Billy Bob Thornton and Steve Buscemi.(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
programme.desc: The swashbuckling rogues join forces with old foe Barbossa to take on villainous Lord Beckett. But first they have to journey to the ends of the Earth to free Captain Jack Sparrow from his hellish imprisonment in Davy Jones' Locker. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Johnny Depp, Geoffrey Rush, Orlando Bloom, Keira Knightley and Chow Yun-Fat, and featuring a cameo appearance by Keith Richards.(n)

programme.title: The Matrix Revolutions
programme.desc: As the survivors of the human race make their last stand against the machines, freedom fighters Neo and Trinity undertake a desperate journey into the heart of the enemy stronghold seeking a way to end the war, while the rogue computer programme Smith sets about remaking the virtual world of the Matrix in his own image. Conclusion of the sci-fi trilogy, starring Keanu Reeves, Carrie-Anne Moss, Laurence Fishburne and Hugo Weaving.(n)

programme.title: Face/Off
programme.desc: FBI agent Sean Archer captures terrorist Castor Troy, the man who killed his son. While Troy is in a coma, Archer has the crook's face surgically grafted onto his own so he can go undercover and locate a bomb planted somewhere in Los Angeles. But then Troy regains consciousness - and in turn takes on Archer's identity. John Woo's action thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, John Travolta, Joan Allen, Gina Gershon and Dominique Swain.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Max
programme.desc: A low-born German fighter pilot's determination to win the flying corps' highest award rankles with his aristocratic comrades. Meanwhile, his clandestine affair with the wife of his commanding officer risks endangering lives and destroying his own reputation. First World War drama based on Jack D Hunter's novel, starring George Peppard, Ursula Andress, James Mason and Jeremy Kemp.(n)

programme.title: Swelter
programme.desc: Ten years after their casino heist, four escaped convicts trace their former partner to a desert town, where he is now a lawman with no memory of his criminal past. Drama, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Alfred Molina and Lennie James.(n)

programme.title: Camino
programme.desc: A photographer ventures deep into the jungles of Colombia to document a group of missionaries. However, when she witnesses the leader of the group committing a horrific crime, she faces a battle for survival to make it back to civilisation with the evidence before his followers have her killed. Action thriller, starring Zoe Bell and Nacho Vigalondo.(n)

programme.title: Rocky
programme.desc: Philadelphia brawler Rocky Balboa gets a shot at the world heavyweight title when current champion Apollo Creed decides to give an unknown boxer a chance in celebration of America's bicentennial. Oscar-winning drama, starring Sylvester Stallone, Burgess Meredith, Talia Shire, Burt Young and Carl Weathers.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible 2
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt sent to find and destroy the only sample of a deadly man-made virus. However, he faces tough opposition in a former spy-turned-criminal mastermind who has already acquired the cure and now wants the pathogen itself. Director John Woo's action thriller sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Dougray Scott, Thandie Newton and Anthony Hopkins.(n)

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: Three private investigators are recruited to rescue a computer genius from the clutches of a rival. They discover there is more at stake than they thought, as the captive genius has created a dangerous piece of software that must not fall into the wrong hands. Action adventure, based on the TV series, starring Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore, Lucy Liu and Bill Murray.(n)

programme.title: Batman & Robin
programme.desc: The caped crusader and his sidekick take on the villainous Mr Freeze, who plans to destroy Gotham City with an icy doomsday weapon unless his demands are met. The dynamic duo also have to contend with femme fatale Poison Ivy, who is determined to drive a wedge between them. Comic-book adventure, starring George Clooney, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Uma Thurman and Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: Rocky
programme.desc: Philadelphia brawler Rocky Balboa gets a shot at the world heavyweight title when current champion Apollo Creed decides to give an unknown boxer a chance in celebration of America's bicentennial. Oscar-winning drama, starring Sylvester Stallone, Burgess Meredith, Talia Shire, Burt Young and Carl Weathers.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible 2
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt sent to find and destroy the only sample of a deadly man-made virus. However, he faces tough opposition in a former spy-turned-criminal mastermind who has already acquired the cure and now wants the pathogen itself. Director John Woo's action thriller sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Dougray Scott, Thandie Newton and Anthony Hopkins.(n)

programme.title: The Mummy
programme.desc: A soldier of fortune joins an academic and her conniving brother on an expedition to an ancient Egyptian lost city. The explorers accidentally cause the spirit of a vengeful priest with awe-inspiring supernatural powers to rise from his tomb, leading to a desperate battle for survival. Fantasy action adventure, starring Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo and Oded Fehr.(n)

programme.title: Sam Churchill: Search for a Homeless Man
programme.desc: A seemingly straightforward missing persons case draws a private investigator into a battle against the members of a child pornography ring, who are holding a teenager he has been hired to find. Thriller, starring John Schneider, Robyn Lively, Alex Rocco and Rudy Ramos.(n)

programme.title: Kite
programme.desc: A teenager living in a corrupt society dominated by violent street gangs swears revenge when her parents are murdered. Joining forces with her father's former partner on the police force, she journeys into the depths of the criminal underworld to learn the killers' identities. Crime thriller, starring India Eisley and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Go With Me
programme.desc: A woman returns to the isolated logging community where she grew up, and is stalked by a former cop, who now heads up a criminal organisation in the area that operates above the law. She resolves to take a stand against him, seeking the aid of a retired logger and his sidekick. Thriller based on Castle Freeman Jr's novel, starring Julia Stiles, Anthony Hopkins, Alexander Ludwig and Ray Liotta.(n)

programme.title: Secret in Their Eyes
programme.desc: A tight-knit FBI team is torn apart when the daughter of one of the agents is raped and murdered, and the case goes unsolved. Years later, a member of the team uncovers a new clue that he hopes will allow him to bring the killer to justice. However, the victim's grieving mother is dissatisfied with the law and takes matters into her own hands. Crime drama, starring Julia Roberts, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Nicole Kidman.(n)

programme.title: The Shallows
programme.desc: Medical student Nancy Adams' plan to honour her late mother puts her face to face with a massive, man-eating shark. Survival horror, starring Blake Lively and Oscar Jaenada.(n)

programme.title: The Joker
programme.desc: A young cop is kidnapped by a masked serial killer. To keep himself alive, the captive detective must rely on the wisdom imparted to him by his older colleagues during their regular poker night, hoping that one of their tall tales might provide the inspiration he needs to outwit the murderer. Thriller, starring Beau Mirchoff and Ron Perlman.(n)

programme.title: Snakes on a Plane
programme.desc: An FBI agent is assigned to protect a witness in the trial of a feared crime boss. However, when they board their flight from Hawaii to Los Angeles, the gangster's henchmen set in motion their plan to smuggle onto the aircraft and then release 450 poisonous snakes. Thriller, starring Samuel L Jackson, Julianna Margulies and Jonathan Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Anti-Social
programme.desc: Crime drama, following the criminal exploits of anarchic street artist Dee and his violent gang member and jewel thief brother Marcus, who live on a London council estate. Starring Gregg Sulkin and Josh Myers.(n)

programme.title: Secret in Their Eyes
programme.desc: A tight-knit FBI team is torn apart when the daughter of one of the agents is raped and murdered, and the case goes unsolved. Years later, a member of the team uncovers a new clue that he hopes will allow him to bring the killer to justice. However, the victim's grieving mother is dissatisfied with the law and takes matters into her own hands. Crime drama, starring Julia Roberts, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Nicole Kidman.(n)

programme.title: The Shallows
programme.desc: Medical student Nancy Adams' plan to honour her late mother puts her face to face with a massive, man-eating shark. Survival horror, starring Blake Lively and Oscar Jaenada.(n)

programme.title: The Silence of the Lambs
programme.desc: Trainee FBI agent Clarice Starling is sent to interview an imprisoned psychopath with a taste for eating his victims. The inmate offers to help catch a serial killer who is holding a politician's daughter hostage - but to learn what he knows, Clarice has to engage in his dangerous mind games. Jonathan Demme's Oscar-winning thriller, based on Thomas Harris's novel, starring Jodie Foster, Anthony Hopkins, Scott Glenn and Ted Levine.(n)

programme.title: Close Range
programme.desc: Action thriller, starring Scott Adkins as a former soldier forced to protect his family from corrupt cops and drug cartel thugs. With Caitlin Keats, Nick Chinlund and Tony Perez.(n)

programme.title: Backtrack
programme.desc: A psychotherapist troubled by strange delusions and recurring nightmares discovers a terrifying secret shared by his patients. The revelation sends him fleeing back to his home town, where he tries to solve a decades-old mystery in the hope that the answer will hold the key to his own issues. Supernatural thriller, starring Adrien Brody and Sam Neill.(n)

programme.title: Play Misty for Me
programme.desc: A DJ has a one-night stand with an obsessive woman who repeatedly calls his station with the same song request. When he revives his relationship with an old flame, his unstable fan is driven mad with jealousy. Psychological thriller, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood, with Jessica Walter, Donna Mills, John Larch and James McEachin.(n)

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster.(n)

programme.title: Extraction
programme.desc: A veteran CIA agent is kidnapped by a terrorist organisation. His son, a government analyst turned down for field service, defies his superiors to mount his own rescue mission. He finds himself battling international assassins and top secret agents to save his father and prevent a terror attack. Action thriller, starring Kellan Lutz, Bruce Willis and Gina Carano.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 2
programme.desc: Headstrong cop Martin Riggs and his cautious partner Roger Murtaugh stumble across a plot by a South African diplomat to launder drugs money by shipping gold coins into the US via his embassy. Protected by diplomatic immunity, the crook looks certain to evade the law - while his chief henchman has a connection to Riggs' traumatic past. Action thriller sequel, with Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Joe Pesci, Joss Ackland, Derrick O'Connor and Patsy Kensit.(n)

programme.title: Money Monster
programme.desc: A TV host and his producer are held hostage live on air by a man who lost everything after following their advice. Crime thriller, with George Clooney and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Dark Places
programme.desc: A seven-year-old girl witnesses the murder of her mother and sisters, and testifies that her teenage brother was the killer, leading to his imprisonment. As an adult, she attends a gathering of true-crime fans, and discovers they all think her brother was innocent. She reluctantly agrees to revisit the crime, and begins to realise her memories may not be as reliable as she thought. Mystery, starring Charlize Theron, Nicholas Hoult, Christina Hendricks and Chloe Grace Moretz.(n)

programme.title: Wild Horses
programme.desc: A detective reopens a fifteen-year-old missing persons investigation and the clues lead her to suspect that the missing boy was murdered and his death is linked to a local rancher. Drama, starring Luciana Duvall, Robert Duvall and James Franco.(n)

programme.title: Money Monster
programme.desc: A TV host and his producer are held hostage live on air by a man who lost everything after following their advice. Crime thriller, with George Clooney and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Extraction
programme.desc: A veteran CIA agent is kidnapped by a terrorist organisation. His son, a government analyst turned down for field service, defies his superiors to mount his own rescue mission. He finds himself battling international assassins and top secret agents to save his father and prevent a terror attack. Action thriller, starring Kellan Lutz, Bruce Willis and Gina Carano.(n)

programme.title: The Colony
programme.desc: A man travelling through Chile in the 1970s is abducted by the secret police during the military coup that brought Pinochet to power. His girlfriend tries to find out what has happened to him, but to uncover the truth, she must join a cult posing as a charitable organisation, from which no one has ever escaped. Drama, starring Emma Watson and Daniel Bruhl.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: An unstable Vietnam veteran cop teams up with a by-the-book Los Angeles police detective to investigate the apparent suicide of the daughter of a wealthy businessman, leading them to a violent and bloody confrontation with a ruthless drug cartel under the control of a retired US general. Action thriller, starring Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Gary Busey, Mitchell Ryan and Tom Atkins.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 2
programme.desc: Headstrong cop Martin Riggs and his cautious partner Roger Murtaugh stumble across a plot by a South African diplomat to launder drugs money by shipping gold coins into the US via his embassy. Protected by diplomatic immunity, the crook looks certain to evade the law - while his chief henchman has a connection to Riggs' traumatic past. Action thriller sequel, with Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Joe Pesci, Joss Ackland, Derrick O'Connor and Patsy Kensit.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: A wage-slave in his uncle's factory has big ambitions. Just as he comes close to marrying a wealthy socialite, a poor working-class girl with whom he had a brief, casual affair tells him she is pregnant with his child. When she threatens to disclose the truth, he makes a series of decisions which bring terrible consequences in their wake. Oscar-winning drama, starring Montgomery Clift, Shelley Winters, Elizabeth Taylor,and Raymond Burr.(n)

programme.title: The Benefactor
programme.desc: A wealthy eccentric blames himself for the deaths of a couple, and looks for a way to make amends. He discovers that their daughter is now expecting her first child, so begins meddling in the lives of both her and her husband in the hope of securing them a better future. Drama, starring Richard Gere, Dakota Fanning and Theo James.(n)

programme.title: Anna and the King of Siam
programme.desc: A widowed English schoolteacher begins a relationship with the powerful monarch of Siam while tutoring his 67 children. Romantic drama, starring Irene Dunne, Rex Harrison and Lee J Cobb.(n)

programme.title: Dirty Dancing 2: Havana Nights
programme.desc: A naive American teenager moves with her wealthy family to 1950s Cuba, where she is bewitched by the pulsing Latin American rhythms. Eventually, a partnership made on the dance floor with a local waiter leads to a passionate romance, but meets with the disapproval of her family. Drama, starring Romola Garai, Diego Luna, Jonathan Jackson, January Jones, and featuring a cameo by Patrick Swayze.(n)

programme.title: Rain Man
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock.(n)

programme.title: Concussion
programme.desc: A doctor discovers a dead American football player died as the result of brain trauma inflicted on the field. He tries to raise awareness of the danger and provide greater protection from injury for players, but finds himself up against a powerful institution determined to bury the risk. Fact-based drama, starring Will Smith, Alec Baldwin and Albert Brooks.(n)

programme.title: Ricki and the Flash
programme.desc: A rock singer who abandoned her family to pursue her dreams of stardom returns to her home town. She gets the chance to make amends for her past mistakes as she reconnects with her ex-husband, and helps her daughter to cope with a difficult time in her life. Comedy drama, starring Meryl Streep, Kevin Kline and Streep's real-life daughter Mamie Gummer.(n)

programme.title: Fathers and Daughters
programme.desc: A writer still recovering from the death of his wife struggles to retain custody of his daughter as he develops a serious illness. Years later, his daughter is now an adult and faces up to the personal issues brought about by her chaotic childhood as she begins a new relationship. Drama, starring Russell Crowe and Amanda Seyfried.(n)

programme.title: Miracles From Heaven
programme.desc: A sick young girl with a rare illness finds herself cured after surviving a terrible accident. Drama, starring Jennifer Garner, Kylie Rogers and Martin Henderson.(n)

programme.title: Southpaw
programme.desc: A boxing champion's successful life is brought to an abrupt end when tragedy strikes. He turns to a trainer coaching amateur fighters in a run-down gym for help and tries to rebuild his sporting career - while also striving to regain the lost trust of his wife and daughter. Drama, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Forest Whitaker and Rachel McAdams.(n)

programme.title: Coach Carter
programme.desc: A former professional basketball player agrees to coach a high-school team, but he is unimpressed by its lack of discipline and instigates a tough new regimen. All goes well until the youngsters start to become complacent, forcing him to take drastic action - which leads to a backlash of complaints from angry parents and pupils alike. Drama, with Samuel L Jackson, Ashanti, Rob Brown and Robert Ri'chard.(n)

programme.title: Sixteen
programme.desc: An African former child soldier now living in London tries to leave his violent past behind him as he approaches his 16th birthday, but when he witnesses a stabbing and the people involved want to make sure that he says nothing to the police, violence forces its way back into his life. Thriller, starring Roger Jean Nsengiyumva, Rachael Stirling and Rosie Day.(n)

programme.title: The Spirit of St Louis
programme.desc: Biopic of pioneering aviator Charles Lindbergh, who began his career flying airmail for the Army, before designing and constructing a plane for a non-stop solo flight from New York to Paris in 1927. As he sets off on his dangerous journey, he looks back over his past experiences in the air. Starring James Stewart, Murray Hamilton, Patricia Smith and Marc Connelly.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Fiddler on the Roof
programme.desc: A poor Jewish milkman is set on finding good husbands for his three eldest daughters while coming to terms with the pressures of village life in Ukraine under Tsarist rule. Unfortunately, his well-meaning plan is hampered by the girls' obstinate insistence on making their own marital choices. Norman Jewison's musical, starring Topol, Norma Crane, Paul Michael Glaser and Leonard Frey.(n)

programme.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
programme.desc: Lively teenager Bianca is not allowed to start dating until her man-hating sister Kat does first - but no boy is brave enough to ask her out. However, Bianca's would-be boyfriend thinks he has found the perfect man for the job in the shape of a quirky loner with a mysterious past. Comedy, based on Shakespeare's The Taming of the Shrew, starring Heath Ledger, Julia Stiles, Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Larisa Oleynik.(n)

programme.title: Take the Lead
programme.desc: A former professional dancer volunteers to pass on his skills to disruptive students in New York's public schools. At first the teenagers and their teachers are sceptical, but he eventually inspires them and persuades the kids to compete in a prestigious contest - in which his classical training and their love of hip-hop fuse to create an entirely new dance style. Fact-based drama, starring Antonio Banderas, Alfre Woodard and Rob Brown.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: A woman joins a campaign to gain the right to vote in 1912. She and her allies find their peaceful protests accomplishing little in the face of an unwavering state, so resort to increasingly violent measures, risking everything they have in the pursuit of political justice. Period drama, starring Carey Mulligan, Helena Bonham Carter, Anne-Marie Duff and Meryl Streep.(n)

programme.title: The Longest Ride
programme.desc: A rodeo rider and a college student fall in love, but begin to question whether they have a future together as their dreams lead them in different directions. They form an unexpected friendship with an old man, whose decades-long tale of love provides them with fresh inspiration. Romantic drama based on the novel by Nicholas Sparks, starring Britt Robertson, Scott Eastwood and Alan Alda.(n)

programme.title: Runaway Bride
programme.desc: A disreputable journalist hopes to get his ailing career back on track by writing an article about a commitment-shy woman famed for ditching bridegrooms at the altar - but complications arise when the pair meet on the eve of her latest attempt at marriage. Romantic comedy, starring Julia Roberts and Richard Gere, with Joan Cusack, Hector Elizondo and Rita Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Pretty Woman
programme.desc: A ruthless millionaire hires a prostitute while on a business trip. Realising she may be useful in helping him keep up a successful appearance, he pays her to accompany him for a week as he associates with the rich and powerful - but falls in love despite their many differences. Romantic comedy, starring Richard Gere and Julia Roberts, with Ralph Bellamy and Laura San Giacomo.(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: An imaginative youngster with dreams of being an inventor grows up to be a downtrodden single mother, struggling to support her chaotic family. She sees a chance to turn all their lives around when inspiration strikes and she creates a new household tool, but faces the challenge of selling her product in the demanding world of a home shopping TV station. Fact-based drama, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Robert De Niro and Bradley Cooper.(n)

programme.title: Teacher's Pet
programme.desc: A family remain unaware their dog is super-intelligent, and able to read and speak. The canine genius disguises himself as a boy so he can go to school and longs to be a real human. He seeks out a mad scientist who claims to be able to turn animals into people, but he soon learns that being human is not all fun. Animated adventure, with the voices of Nathan Lane and Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Huck Finn
programme.desc: A youngster is forced to stage his own death to escape his cruel father, and embarks on a series of adventures accompanied by a runaway slave in 19th-century Mississippi. Disney adaptation of Mark Twain's classic tale, starring Elijah Wood, Courtney B Vance, Robbie Coltrane, Jason Robards, Dana Ivey, Anne Heche and Ron Perlman.(n)

programme.title: Barnyard
programme.desc: A fun-loving male cow who spends his time hanging out with his friends and partying all night is forced to accept responsibility for the first time in his life, after being placed in charge of the farmyard following the untimely demise of his father. Animated comedy, with the voices of Kevin James, Courteney Cox, Sam Elliott, Danny Glover and Andie MacDowell.(n)

programme.title: Rabbit School: Guardians Of The Golden Egg
programme.desc: When the Easter rabbit school comes under threat from a family of foxes plotting to steal the legendary golden egg, it's up to young Max to save the day. Animated adventure, featuring the voice of Noah Levi and Senta Berger.(n)

programme.title: Throne of Elves
programme.desc: In the mythical realm of Altera, young hero Lambert is drawn into a bitter conflict between elf princess Liya and her malevolent rival, Elena. Epic animated fantasy, featuring the voices of Ashley Boettcher and GK Bowes.(n)

programme.title: Pan
programme.desc: A 12-year-old orphan is abducted and taken away to a magical land by a band of pirates, who need child labour to mine a magical substance created by fairies. He escapes, joining forces with a roguish adventurer, and goes in search of the truth about his mother and his own destiny. Fantasy adventure prequel to Peter Pan, starring Levi Miller, Hugh Jackman, Garrett Hedlund and Rooney Mara.(n)

programme.title: Barnyard
programme.desc: A fun-loving male cow who spends his time hanging out with his friends and partying all night is forced to accept responsibility for the first time in his life, after being placed in charge of the farmyard following the untimely demise of his father. Animated comedy, with the voices of Kevin James, Courteney Cox, Sam Elliott, Danny Glover and Andie MacDowell.(n)

programme.title: Rabbit School: Guardians Of The Golden Egg
programme.desc: When the Easter rabbit school comes under threat from a family of foxes plotting to steal the legendary golden egg, it's up to young Max to save the day. Animated adventure, featuring the voice of Noah Levi and Senta Berger.(n)

programme.title: Throne of Elves
programme.desc: In the mythical realm of Altera, young hero Lambert is drawn into a bitter conflict between elf princess Liya and her malevolent rival, Elena. Epic animated fantasy, featuring the voices of Ashley Boettcher and GK Bowes.(n)

He escapes, joining forces with a roguish adventurer, and goes in search of the truth about his mother and his own destiny. Fantasy adventure prequel to Peter Pan, starring Levi Miller, Hugh Jackman, Garrett Hedlund and Rooney Mara.(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Huck Finn
programme.desc: A youngster is forced to stage his own death to escape his cruel father, and embarks on a series of adventures accompanied by a runaway slave in 19th-century Mississippi. Disney adaptation of Mark Twain's classic tale, starring Elijah Wood, Courtney B Vance, Robbie Coltrane, Jason Robards, Dana Ivey, Anne Heche and Ron Perlman.(n)

programme.title: The Big Green
programme.desc: An English teacher provides her American pupils with an introduction to the joys of soccer, giving them the pride and ability to take on the best at the state championships, and winning the heart of the local sheriff along the way. Sporting comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Olivia d'Abo and Jay O Sanders.(n)

programme.title: Dennis
programme.desc: A well-meaning little boy with an inability to stay out of trouble is the bane of his curmudgeonly neighbour, Mr Wilson. But when a thief steals Wilson's coin collection, the tiny terror seizes the chance to make amends and come to the rescue. Slapstick comedy based on the comic strip, starring Walter Matthau, Mason Gamble, Joan Plowright, Christopher Lloyd and Lea Thompson.(n)

programme.title: DuckTales the Movie: Treasure of the Lost Lamp
programme.desc: Scrooge McDuck and great-nephews Huey, Dewey and Louie lead an archaeological expedition to find a long-lost genie's lamp once belonging to a notorious bandit, but reckon without a villainous attempt to use its powers in a dastardly plot. Animated Disney adventure, with the voices of Christopher Lloyd, Alan Young and Russi Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Paulie
programme.desc: An intelligent parrot falls into late-night conversation with a janitor and ends up recounting the tale of his epic cross-country journey in search of a new life - a plan that went awry when an evil scientist managed to get his hands on the brilliant bird for his own nefarious ends. Family adventure, starring Gena Rowlands, Tony Shalhoub, Cheech Marin, Bruce Davison and the voice of Jay Mohr.(n)

programme.title: Race to Witch Mountain
programme.desc: An ex-convict cab driver becomes the protector of two aliens disguised as children who claim to hold the key to Earth's continued existence. As he races against time to return the visitors to their spaceship, he must also hold off hostile government agents and a sinister extraterrestrial assassin. Sci-fi adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, AnnaSophia Robb, Alexander Ludwig and Carla Gugino.(n)

programme.title: Garfield: A Tale of Two Kitties
programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. He is promptly mistaken for an English upper-class cat, who has recently inherited a grand estate, and moves into his stately home - much to the dismay of the real aristocratic feline's conniving relation, who is bent on swindling him out of his money. Family comedy, starring Breckin Meyer, Billy Connolly and Jennifer Love Hewitt, with the voices of Bill Murray and Tim Curry.(n)

programme.title: An Eskimo Tale
programme.desc: When animals start mysteriously disappearing, three young Inuits embark on a perilous journey to save their tribe from ruin. Animated adventure, with the voice of Christopher Plummer.(n)

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip
programme.desc: The singing rodents mistakenly come to the conclusion that their human friend Dave intends to get rid of them when he proposes to his girlfriend in Miami. With only three days until Dave pops the question, the trio embark on a desperate road trip across America to sabotage his romantic plans. Family comedy sequel, starring Jason Lee and Kimberly Williams-Paisley.(n)

programme.title: Horton Hears a Who
programme.desc: A kindly elephant hears a cry of help coming from a speck of dust and discovers the minuscule city of Whoville. As he tries to help its citizens, the other animals begin to question his sanity, and the evil Kangaroo incites them to turn against the do-gooder. Animated adaptation of Dr Seuss's book, with the voices of Jim Carrey, Steve Carell, Carol Burnett, Seth Rogen and Will Arnett.(n)

programme.title: Treasure Buddies
programme.desc: Five golden retriever puppies embark on a danger-filled quest halfway across the world as they search for the greatest treasure known to animalkind. Arriving in Egypt, the canine explorers make some new exotic friends and search through ancient ruins as they try to stop devious sphynx cat Ubasti from claiming their prize. Family adventure sequel, with the voices of Skyler Gisondo and Elaine Hendrix.(n)

programme.title: Garfield: A Tale of Two Kitties
programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. He is promptly mistaken for an English upper-class cat, who has recently inherited a grand estate, and moves into his stately home - much to the dismay of the real aristocratic feline's conniving relation, who is bent on swindling him out of his money. Family comedy, starring Breckin Meyer, Billy Connolly and Jennifer Love Hewitt, with the voices of Bill Murray and Tim Curry.(n)

programme.desc: When animals start mysteriously disappearing, three young Inuits embark on a perilous journey to save their tribe from ruin. Animated adventure, with the voice of Christopher Plummer.(n)

Animated adaptation of Dr Seuss's book, with the voices of Jim Carrey, Steve Carell, Carol Burnett, Seth Rogen and Will Arnett.(n)

programme.desc: An ex-convict cab driver becomes the protector of two aliens disguised as children who claim to hold the key to Earth's continued existence. As he races against time to return the visitors to their spaceship, he must also hold off hostile government agents and a sinister extraterrestrial assassin. Sci-fi adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, AnnaSophia Robb, Alexander Ludwig and Carla Gugino.(n)

programme.title: Scooby-Doo 2: Monsters Unleashed
programme.desc: The amateur detectives attend the grand opening of a museum in their honour, featuring the costumes from all the fake monsters they exposed. The exhibits are stolen by a masked villain, who sets about re-creating all the gang's worst enemies. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Sarah Michelle Gellar, Matthew Lillard, Freddie Prinze Jr and Linda Cardellini.(n)

programme.title: Frankie & Alice
programme.desc: Premiere. A black dancer develops multiple personality disorder, with one of her alter egos an angry white racist from the Deep South. With the help of a psychiatrist, she delves into her past in the hope of identifying the childhood trauma that has caused her condition. Fact-based drama, starring Halle Berry and Stellan Skarsgard.(n)

programme.title: Miles
programme.desc: Premiere. A teenage lad is desperate to move to Chicago and joins the volleyball team to get a scholarship. The problem is his high school only has a girls squad. Comedy drama, starring Missi Pyle, Stephen Root and Paul Reiser.(n)

programme.title: I'll See You in My Dreams
programme.desc: A retired widow leads a quiet life, but when her dog dies, she finds herself feeling unfulfilled, and decides she needs to broaden her horizons with fresh experiences. She strikes up a friendship with a handyman, and reluctantly attends a speed dating event, where she becomes open to the possibility of a new romance. Comedy drama, starring Blythe Danner, Martin Starr, Sam Elliott and Malin Akerman.(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming: Special
programme.desc: The making of the new Marvel superhero movie, which sees Tom Holland as the friendly neighbourhood Spider-Man, taking on Michael Keaton's Vulture with the help of Iron Man.(n)

programme.title: Inferno
programme.desc: Robert Langdon awakes with amnesia in an Italian hospital, and is soon on the run with a beautiful doctor. Racing to stop a devastating virus, the Da Vinci Code expert suffers shocking visions as an assassin closes in. Thriller, starring Tom Hanks, Felicity Jones and Irrfan Khan.(n)

programme.title: The Girl with All the Gifts
programme.desc: A scientist and a teacher living in a dystopian future embark on a journey of survival with a young girl named Melanie. Horror thriller, starring Gemma Arterton, Paddy Considine, Glenn Close and Sennia Nanua.(n)

programme.title: Frankie & Alice
programme.desc: Premiere. A black dancer develops multiple personality disorder, with one of her alter egos an angry white racist from the Deep South. With the help of a psychiatrist, she delves into her past in the hope of identifying the childhood trauma that has caused her condition. Fact-based drama, starring Halle Berry and Stellan Skarsgard.(n)

programme.title: I'll See You in My Dreams
programme.desc: A retired widow leads a quiet life, but when her dog dies, she finds herself feeling unfulfilled, and decides she needs to broaden her horizons with fresh experiences. She strikes up a friendship with a handyman, and reluctantly attends a speed dating event, where she becomes open to the possibility of a new romance. Comedy drama, starring Blythe Danner, Martin Starr, Sam Elliott and Malin Akerman.(n)

programme.title: Dog Eat Dog
programme.desc: Premiere. A crew of former prisoners are hired by a Cleveland crime syndicate to kidnap the baby of a rival mobster. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Willem Dafoe and Christopher Matthew Cook.(n)

programme.title: Breakdown
programme.desc: Premiere. A founding member of a secret society of assassins struggles to cope, as memories of his past misdeeds cause panic attacks and his family starts to fall apart. When he breaks down during the torture of a captive, his employers fear he is no longer reliable - and threaten the lives of his wife and daughter. Action thriller, starring Craig Fairbrass and James Cosmo.(n)

programme.title: Miles
programme.desc: Premiere. A teenage lad is desperate to move to Chicago and joins the volleyball team to get a scholarship. The problem is his high school only has a girls squad. Comedy drama, starring Missi Pyle, Stephen Root and Paul Reiser.(n)

programme.title: The Here After
programme.desc: Premiere. A teenager is released from a young offenders' institution and returns to his family home. He is forced to endure a life of silent misery as his past crimes inspire bullying from his schoolfriends, while their suspicious parents take steps to drive him from the community altogether. His only solace comes in a friendship with a girl who is fascinated by his dark past. Drama, starring Ulrik Munther and Mats Blomgren. In Swedish.(n)

programme.title: Assault on Precinct 13
programme.desc: Jean-François Richet's remake of John Carpenter's 1976 cult classic rivals the original for tension and action. Ethan Hawke plays Jake Roenick, a police sergeant in charge of closing down defunct cop shop Precinct 13 with old timer Jasper O'Shea and secretary Iris Ferry. But a bus taking drugs lord Marion Bishop to prison is caught up in traffic chaos and he and the other prisoners are dumped on Roenick and his team. Bishop is due to give evidence that would expose cop corruption at the highest level and when Marcus Duvall, one of those under threat, finds out where Bishop is being held, he gathers a gang to take him out. And only Roenick and his rag-bag collection of cons, cops and civilians can stop them(n)

programme.title: Death Do Us Part
programme.desc: An engaged couple take their friends on a pre-wedding party getaway that turns murderous as guests are killed off one at a time(n)

programme.title: The Final Cut
programme.desc: Omar Naim's science-fiction thriller is set in a world where Zoe memory implants capture every memory. Retrieved after the subject's death, the implant is sent to a 'Cutter' for editing into a two-hour video for the bereaved. Alan Harkman is one of the best in the business and is hired by Jennifer Bannister to edit the memory of her husband, who was CEO of the company that developed Zoe. He also abused children, including their daughter, areas Harkman erases until he sees a face from his own past that sends him on his own quest. There is also a subplot with a rebel Cutter, Fletcher, who belongs to a group that believes the implants inhibit natural human expression, and wants Bannister's implant for their own reasons. This intelligent film was released in the same year as the similarly themed Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind and The Manchurian Candidate but received a surprisingly limited release in Britain; this is a rare chance to enjoy it(n)

programme.title: Bridge of Spies
programme.desc: In this historical drama set during the Cold War, a Brooklyn attorney (Tom Hanks) is tasked with negotiating a prisoner exchange between an American pilot who was shot down over the USSR and a Soviet spy serving a 45-year sentence for espionage against the U.S. Bridge of Spies was directed by Steven Spielberg and written by Matt Charman and Joel and Ethan Coen(n)

programme.title: Snowden
programme.desc: Searing docudrama about whistle-blower Edward Snowden, who decided to leak classified information from the NSA in order to expose a massive, covert surveillance program orchestrated by the U.S. government. The film traces Snowden's career in both the NSA and CIA as he becomes disillusioned with his work and receives support from his idealistic girlfriend(n)

programme.title: The Boondock Saints
programme.desc: Feeling that they are doing God's will, two Catholic men from Boston set out to kill everyone in this Reservoir Dogs-style vigilante thriller. Brothers Conner and Murphy MacManus (Sean Patrick Flanery and Norman Reedus) take to performing their divine duty against the Russian mob. They massacre a bunch of unsuspecting Mafioso in a scene of absurd violence, then they let more blood in a mass killing of porn-shop customers. Instead of getting thrown in jail, they are dubbed "saints" by the Boston Herald, and they are praised by brilliant, tortured, and gay FBI agent Paul Smecker (Willem Dafoe)(n)

programme.title: Primal Fear
programme.desc: Chicago lawyer Martin Vail smells a big payday in the case of an altar boy accused of murdering a Catholic archbishop(n)

programme.desc: In this historical drama set during the Cold War, a Brooklyn attorney (Tom Hanks) is tasked with negotiating a prisoner exchange between an American pilot who was shot down over the USSR and a Soviet spy serving a 45-year sentence for espionage against the U.S. Bridge of Spies was directed by Steven Spielberg and written by Matt Charman and Joel and Ethan Coen(n)

programme.desc: The Return. Goldie pitches an idea her lover/lawyer Eli believes he can sell; Nick returns to Goldie's after a long and mysterious hiatus; Adam begins a new handyman job and quickly learns there is more to the gig than was promised; Ralph is visited by a Vietnam buddy(n)

programme.desc: In this poignant coming-of-age tale set in 1978 London, a teen named Shay starts listening to the Clash in order to impress a punk-obsessed girl. Soon after, Shay keeps running into Joe Strummer, the Clash's lead singer, who gives him life advice(n)

programme.desc: Chicago lawyer Martin Vail smells a big payday in the case of an altar boy accused of murdering a Catholic archbishop(n)

programme.title: Alpha Dog
